Full Job Description
Dow has internship opportunities during the summer of 2022 within its Information Systems organization for individuals who are within one or two years of graduation and are currently enrolled in a university working towards a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a related technical field. The internships will be located in one of the global IT centers - at Dow's global headquarters in Midland, MI or nearby in Auburn, MI. The duration of these internships is typically 12 weeks.

Interns will be involved in projects that are critical to moving forward Dow’s IT Strategy and digitally transforming the organization. They will support critical business and technical needs for Dow business, research, and manufacturing functions around the world in a variety of process & technology areas including but not limited to artificial intelligence/machine learning, analytics, SAP, mobile and/or desktop application development, cloud architectures and contemporary security solutions.

Interns will be involved in one or more of the following:
Systems Solutions: Planning, designing, creating and implementing enterprise-wide or business specific technology and solutions. Managing change, delivering corporate-wide technology upgrades, minimizing risks, and enhancing employee productivity through increased familiarity with the capabilities we provide.

Information Security: Preserving the integrity of Dow information and containing problems before they have an impact. Safeguarding ideas, protecting our data, network and equipment from intrusions before they begin.

Service Management and Business I/S: Ensuring all Dow employees have the technology tools they need to be productive. Listening to our stakeholders – employees, suppliers and customers – and using that information to propel Dow forward.

Operations: Ensuring that everything from the Dow network to the Dow intranet is stable and working smoothly.

IT Technology Architecture: Researching and designing the information technology platform to enhance productivity at Dow. Testing the theories, enhancing the concepts, and exploring future information technology opportunities.

The incumbent may work together with support personnel from the United States; Sao Paulo, Brazil; Mumbai, India; and Shanghai, China, as well as, clients from any other Dow global location.

Candidates must have a strong interest in the application of information technology to meet rapidly changing business needs. They must have good judgment, good problem solving skills, and the ability to work with diverse, global teams in an empowered environment. Strong human relations skills, teamwork, and flexibility are essential for success.

Minimum Requirements:
Must be within one or two years of graduation and currently enrolled in a university working towards a Bachelor's or Master's degree in a related technical field. Preferred degrees in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, or Computer Engineering.
A minimum 2.700+ cumulative GPA on a 4.000 scale at your current university is required, but we are seeking GPAs of 3.000 or higher.
A minimum requirement for this US-based position is the ability to work legally in the United States on a permanent basis.

Dow (NYSE: DOW) combines global breadth, asset integration and scale, focused innovation and leading business positions to achieve profitable growth. The Company’s ambition is to become the most innovative, customer centric, inclusive and sustainable materials science company, with a purpose to deliver a sustainable future for the world through our materials science expertise and collaboration with our partners. Dow’s portfolio of plastics, industrial intermediates, coatings and silicones businesses delivers a broad range of differentiated science-based products and solutions for its customers in high-growth market segments, such as packaging, infrastructure, mobility and consumer care. We seek motivated interns to support the work of the United Nations Operations and Crisis Centre, which reports to the Assistant Secretary-General for Strategic Coordination through the Director of Strategic Planning and Monitoring in the Executive Office of the Secretary-General (EOSG) with additional reporting line to the Director for Coordination and Shared Services (ODCSS) of the Departments of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs and Peace Operations (DPPA-DPO) with regard to services for the peace and security pillar. Responsibilities

TRACK 1: Data Analysis, Visualization and Reporting
  • Conduct independent research, including data validation and informed selection of quantitative indicators, to support cross-pillar and integrated reporting needs; help fill data gaps and outputs in countries where primary data availability is low using secondary sources; help strengthen data-driven domain knowledge (economic, conflict, human rights, etc) captured in analytical products and reports;
  • Assist in generating visual slides for cross-pillar and integrated-reporting outputs to senior UN leadership using standard methodology and templates; help develop and maintain standard data and visual templates; Assist in producing custom visual outputs such as charts, graphs, infographics using graphing tools or via standard graphic design software like Adobe Suite;
  • Assist in creating basic maps (base, choropleth, heat, proportional, dot density) and satellite imagery notation using standard geospatial techniques and GIS software;
  • Help build, process, organize, and transcribe structured surveys to support evidence-based decision making and internal consensus building; Assist in the development and maintenance the survey codebook and database;
  • Help systematically analyze and produce reports on decisions made in the risk preventions forums administered by the UNOCC;
  • Develop dashboards and visualizations for senior managers and provide user support;
  • Assist with ad-hoc analysis and reporting needs by helping validate, process and organize datasets;
TRACK 2: Data Science
  • Support the update and maintenance of risk models and composite indices, that draw upon internal and external sources - including checking data preparation scripts, BI pipelines, relationship models, forecasting/data imputation workflows and scripts, and transformation steps;
  • Assist in the research and design of statistical methodology for survey analytics, including correlation, bias, trend analysis based on peer reviewed and scientific methodology, and contribute to the python source code for workflow automation;
  • Assist in testing (statistics, winsorisation, correlation testing, score mapping, aggregation) and developing standard Composite Indicators and Scoreboards tool/workflow for long-term and short-term risk indices;
TRACK 3: Data Pipeline and Systems Engineering
  • Assist in automating survey to reporting workflow using cloud-based systems and serverless tools;
  • Help monitor and troublesoothe unexpected issues in data harvesting systems and scripts (Azure Functions, MQuery, Python Scripts, Azure Data Factory)
  • Assist in developing and maintaining the decision trackers and reporting pipelines across prevention forums;
  • Assist in the routine maintenance and strengthening of the data catalogue supporting all reporting mechanisms such as RMRs, ECDC, FactPacks etc, using standard data deployment pipelines;
Competencies

COMMUNICATION
  • Speaks and writes clearly and effectively
  • Listens to others, correctly interprets messages from others and responds appropriately
  • Asks questions to clarify and exhibits interest in having two-way communication
  • Tailors language, tone, style and format to match the audience
  • Demonstrates openness in sharing information and keeping people informed
PLANNING AND ORGANIZING
  • Develops clear goals that are consistent with agreed strategies
  • Identifies priority activities and assignments; adjusts priorities as required
  • Allocates appropriate amount of time and resources for completing work
  • Foresees risks and allows for contingencies when planning
  • Monitors and adjusts plans and actions as necessary
TECHNOLOGICAL AWARENESS
  • Actively seeks to apply emerging technology across tasks
  • Keeps abreast of available technology
  • Understands applicability and opportunities of technology for the organization
Education

Applicants must meet one of the following requirements: (a) be enrolled in a graduate school programme (second university degree or equivalent, or higher); or (b) be enrolled in the final academic year of a first university degree programme (minimum Bachelor's level or equivalent); or (c) have graduated with a university degree (as defined above) and, if selected, must commence the internship within a one year period of graduation;
The field of study must be closely related to the type of internship you are applying for. Studies in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Information Management, GIS, Statistics, Mathematics, Management and Strategy, Analytics, Operations Research, Data Visualization or Information Design, Economics, Business Administration or closely-related fields;

All interested candidates must:
  • Be computer literate in standard software applications such as Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint;
  • Have a keen interest in the work of the United Nations and a personal commitment to the ideals of the Charter;
  • Have the ability and willingness in working in a high-paced executive setting - ability to take initiative, assess priorities, handle multiple assignments, and meet deadlines;
  • Have a demonstrated ability to successfully interact with individuals of different cultural backgrounds and beliefs, which include willingness to try and understand and be tolerant of differing opinions and views;
  • Ability to understand or use at least one computer programming language to work effectively with data;
  • Ability to understand and apply basic statistics;
Work Experience

No working experience is required to apply for the United Nations Internship Programme. Your training, education, advance course work or skills should benefit the United Nations during your internship.
TRACK 1: Data Analysis, Visualization and Reporting
  • Keen interest in supporting systematic integrated analysis and cross-pillar reporting
  • Excellent presentation design skills (knowledge of Adobe InDesign / Illustrator an advantage); experience generating custom data visualization is an advantage
  • Strong knowledge of data management techniques, quantitative / qualitative analysis; ability to quickly merge disparate information sources using business intelligence or similar tools, and generate reports and analytical outputs
  • Strong knowledge of one or more analytics tools (e.g. Power BI, Excel, Tableau, Infogram, PowerPoint, SQL, R, Python)
  • Experience in the use of GIS tools such as ArcGIS and QGIS for mapping; ability to execute geospatial analysis workflows an advantage
TRACK 2: Data Science
  • Keen interest in supporting systematic data-driven hypothesis testing, drawing verifiable insights, finding hidden patterns, and supporting scientific rigor in analytical workflows
  • Strong knowledge of data extraction, wrangling and mining techniques from APIs or disparate pipelines; ability to check and correct data quality issues using statistical methods
  • Knowledge of data modelling processes; ability to work with composite indices and models is an advantage
  • Experience in supervised, unsupervised and reinforcement learning using machine learning algorithms such as natural language processing, logistic regression, kNN, Random Forest or gradient boosting to optimize business needs an advantage
  • Experience supporting systematic workflows using GIS data for geospatial analysis such as spatial aggregation, density, clustering, hotspot, proximity, change an advantage
TRACK 3: Data Systems Engineering
  • Keen interest in the information systems design and integrating scalable and future-proof technologies for business process optimization
  • Strong knowledge of data harvesting techniques and tools; experience with API testing workflows and tools an advantage
  • Experience in Azure or AWS based tools and services for data pipeline engineering an advantage
Languages

Fluency in English (both oral and written) is required; Knowledge of another UN official language is an advantage.

Assessment

Evaluation of qualified candidates may include an assessment exercise which may be followed by competency-based interview.

Special Notice

Internships starting after 1 September 2021 will be in person at the duty station in New York (USA), local conditions permitting, with the option of flexible working arrangements.

Selected candidates may need to make proper arrangements to obtain a G4 visa if they are not US citizens or permanent residents.

The internship is for a minimum period of three months, with possibility of extension up to six months. In their cover note, interested candidates should indicate their availability.

  • Fall (September - December)
  • Winter/Spring (January - April)
  • Summer (May - August)
In the cover note, candidate should also indicate the track they are interested in:
  • Track 1: Data Analysis, Visualization and Reporting
  • Track 2: Data Science
  • Track 3: Data Systems Engineering
United Nations Considerations
The United Nations internship programme does not provide remuneration; All internship related expenses – travel, insurance, living etc. – are the responsibility of the intern, sponsoring Government or institution; The UN accepts no responsibility for costs arising from accidents, illness or death during the internship; The intern is responsible for obtaining necessary visas and arranging travel to and from the duty station where the internship will be performed; Interns are not eligible to apply for, or be appointed to, any post in UN during the period of the internship or for six months immediately following the end of the internship; The intern must provide proof of enrolment in health insurance plan; Interns are not staff members and may not represent the UN in any official capacity; Due to the high volume of applications received, we can only contact successful candidates; Interns work full time - five days per week.

United Nations Considerations

According to article 101, paragraph 3, of the Charter of the United Nations, the paramount consideration in the employment of the staff is the necessity of securing the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity. Candidates will not be considered for employment with the United Nations if they have committed violations of international human rights law, violations of international humanitarian law, sexual exploitation, sexual abuse, or sexual harassment, or if there are reasonable grounds to believe that they have been involved in the commission of any of these acts. The term “sexual exploitation” means any actual or attempted abuse of a position of vulnerability, differential power, or trust, for sexual purposes, including, but not limited to, profiting monetarily, socially or politically from the sexual exploitation of another. The term “sexual abuse” means the actual or threatened physical intrusion of a sexual nature, whether by force or under unequal or coercive conditions. The term “sexual harassment” means any unwelcome conduct of a sexual nature that might reasonably be expected or be perceived to cause offence or humiliation, when such conduct interferes with work, is made a condition of employment or creates an intimidating, hostile or offensive work environment, and when the gravity of the conduct warrants the termination of the perpetrator’s working relationship. Candidates who have committed crimes other than minor traffic offences may not be considered for employment.

Due regard will be paid to the importance of recruiting the staff on as wide a geographical basis as possible. The United Nations places no restrictions on the eligibility of men and women to participate in any capacity and under conditions of equality in its principal and subsidiary organs. The United Nations Secretariat is a non-smoking environment.

The paramount consideration in the appointment, transfer, or promotion of staff shall be the necessity of securing the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity. By accepting an offer of appointment, United Nations staff members are subject to the authority of the Secretary-General and assignment by him or her to any activities or offices of the United Nations in accordance with staff regulation 1.2 (c). In this context, all internationally recruited staff members shall be required to move periodically to discharge new functions within or across duty stations under conditions established by the Secretary-General.

Applicants are urged to follow carefully all instructions available in the online recruitment platform, inspira. For more detailed guidance, applicants may refer to the Manual for the Applicant, which can be accessed by clicking on “Manuals” hyper-link on the upper right side of the inspira account-holder homepage.

The evaluation of applicants will be conducted on the basis of the information submitted in the application according to the evaluation criteria of the job opening and the applicable internal legislations of the United Nations including the Charter of the United Nations, resolutions of the General Assembly, the Staff Regulations and Rules, administrative issuances and guidelines. Applicants must provide complete and accurate information pertaining to their personal profile and qualifications according to the instructions provided in inspira to be considered for the current job opening. No amendment, addition, deletion, revision or modification shall be made to applications that have been submitted. Candidates under serious consideration for selection will be subject to reference checks to verify the information provided in the application.

Job openings advertised on the Careers Portal will be removed at 11:59 p.m. (New York time) on the deadline date.

No Fee

THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE AT ANY STAGE OF THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS (APPLICATION, INTERVIEW MEETING, PROCESSING, OR TRAINING). THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CONCERN ITSELF WITH INFORMATION ON APPLICANTS’ BANK ACCOUNTS.

position: Data Science Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship - Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Description
At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation. We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.
We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America's Best Large Employers in 2021 and for the ninth consecutive year, BASF was named one of the Top 50 Companies for Diversity by DiversityInc, moving up two places from 14 in 2020 to 12 in 2021. BASF was also recognized as a Top Company for Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) for its corporate social responsibility and philanthropic programs, practices and investments. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!
Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship – Data Science Summer 2022 BASF's Data Science Summer Internship is created to provide highly motivated, mobile-minded current university students an opportunity to enhance their professional skills through a variety of diverse learning experiences. Participants will contribute to leading-edge data science projects and will be guided to apply data science skills in a real-world setting. Where the Chemistry Happens… You start as an intern in a leading-edge team with expertise in Data Science, Statistics, and Operations Research - Advanced Business Analytics (ABA). Advanced Business Analytics co-creates and delivers innovative data-driven solutions for better business decisions through mathematical modeling. These solutions are developed and delivered in collaboration with all business and functional units (including Procurement, Production, Supply Chain, Planning & Controlling, Marketing & Sales, and Finance).
Responsible for leveraging mathematics to propel paradigm shifts across the entire company, the Intern will support the initiation, execution, and completion of projects in the areas of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Optimization to increase business profitability and reduce costs.
The Intern will be ‘hands-on’ and work on projects to execute deliverables during all phases of an analytics project, starting from project definition to completion. Deliverables will include the development of the appropriate mathematical models, collaborating with members from other functions to gather and validate the necessary data, and presenting the project results and benefits to key stake holders and internal clients. Also, communicating the ideas and solutions of advanced business analytics to a broad community of non-mathematicians and acting as a driving force in international and interdisciplinary project teams will be a key success-factor.

Program Summary:
As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a summer internship program at one of BASF’s North American sites
Utilizing your experience in your area of study, you will help complete various data science projects which will provide the opportunity to further develop both technical and professional skills
Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You… We offer students the opportunity to spend a summer working at a North American BASF site within the U.S. to apply their education and background to challenging assignments that build both technical and professional skills. Our PDP internship is a precursor to our rotational programs, which combine hands-on experience with unparalleled networking and development opportunities designed to accelerate your career at BASF.
Enhanced career development and the opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company
Development of your expertise and the ability to network at senior levels throughout BASF and establish mentoring relationships that could span across your whole career
The opportunity for consideration of future opportunities within the organization including the Full-time Data Science Professional Development Program To learn more about our programs, please visit www.basf.com/universitycareers .
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent

Formula for Success:
Undergraduate students majoring in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Chemical Engineering, or related field
Authorization to work in the U.S. now and in the future without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
College Juniors preferred (May 2023 - July 2023 grads)
Demonstrated academic achievement (Minimum GPA 3.2)
Commitment to relocate anywhere in the U.S.
Programming experience in R and Python, other languages a plus
Strong analytical skills
Fast learner
Motivated to learn about machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and new technologies
Active participation in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations
Previous internship/co-op experience is a plus

Full Job Description
Student Intern (Compiler) - Job Description

Latent AI, founded in 2019, is a technology spinout from SRI International, based on years of DARPA research. Latent AI takes the hard work out of embedding complex AI models into hardware so developers can speed the time to market. With our Adaptive AI™ technology, which is framework, OS, architecture, and hardware agnostic, we transform the way developers train AI for the edge enabling rapid AI deployment to lean edge devices at scale.

This internship position will involve research and development of algorithms and software systems. You will help develop algorithms and software for a compiler framework. We are looking for continuing college or university students in good standing at an accredited institution pursuing a graduate degree in computer architecture, compiler design, system software or a related field.

Students will have the opportunity to work with engineers, AI scientists, and technical staff members to provide technical and/or research support to projects in the areas of compiler engineering, AI engineering, or other related fields.

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering. Masters / PhD preferred
Proven experience in compiler design, machine learning, or related areas

Desired skills

Proven ability to work on collaborative software development
Experience with LLVM
Experience with MLIR, Glow or TVM is preferable but not required
Experience using machine learning frameworks (Tensorflow, PyTorch, Keras) is preferable but not required

Latent AI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

position: Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please
description:
Full Job Description
My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1).
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

#21-00377-Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer-Full Time-No C2C or Visas-No Interns/Trainees Please.

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Career Developers Inc.
3000 N Ocean Drive, S. 5H
Riviera Beach, FL 33404

Specializing in Contract and Permanent hiring in Technology/Pharma/Accounting/Marketing
Link to our open jobs http://www.careerdevelopers.com

position: Summer 2022 Internship Program - Data Analytics Internship
description:
Full Job Description
Overview:
With a focus on the Federal Government, Kearney & Company provides financial services, including auditing, consulting, and technology services. Our commitment to our employees and clients as well as to dedication and trust, critical values to our Firm, have led to Kearney’s recognition as one of the leading accounting firms in the country. Based on our employees’ feedback, we are also consistently rated a Best Place to Work. Employment at Kearney means a flexible, collaborative, and open-minded work environment. We hope it is your “first easy decision.” Learn more at www.kearneyco.com/careers.

Responsibilities:
Kearney & Company is seeking students majoring in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Analytics, Data Science, Financial Mathematics, or Statistics (or other synonym for IT related major) for our Summer Internship Program. The Kearney & Company Summer Internship Program offers a dynamic experience which includes teamwork on federal client sites (depending on the assignment), the opportunity to contribute to and learn about the workplace, and the chance to build a larger professional network. Participation in Kearney’s Internship Program also includes an Intern led company-wide community service project. This is a unique role for you to get heavily involved in both financial and operational management and data analytics process and make an immediate impact working closely with audit teams to help establish and build strong client relationships.

Highly competitive pay
Week-long Intern Orientation process and training opportunities

Our Los Angeles office is seeking interns who are currently pursuing a bachelor of arts or masters in marketing, computer science, photography, design or other related fields to assist our marketing team.   • Deep knowledge of Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, and Snapchat
  • Incredible attention to detail
  • Photoshop/Adobe Illustrator skills are a major plus, but not required

PERKS

Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world’s leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our 22,000 employees do the can’t be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.
The qualified applicant will operate in an internship capacity providing support to Peraton's Air Program Information Management System (APIMS) software development team, to help maintain and develop APIMS; an enterprise Web application that is used world-wide by over 200 Department of Defense installations. The applicant will also have the opportunity to be mentored by an exceptional team of engineers with a collective century of experience in a variety of industries.
Seeking local candidates in Davis/Weber county area.

0 or more years of experience

Must be able to qualify for "Position of Trust"

Any experience in the technical areas is a plus
Prior internships in technical area helpful

Full Job Description
Newport, Kentucky or REMOTE

One of the fastest growing companies in the Tri-State, DMG is a recognized Top Workplace, and among the Top Privately Held Companies with a 50% increase in sales volume in the last year alone. We are a national leader in Facilities Maintenance, but we consider ourselves a technology company, handling thousands of properties across the country from one, centralized location in Newport, KY. Using cutting edge technology, we attract new customers daily.

Our Project Analyst Intern will be supporting the Sales Effectiveness team. Responsibilities include:
Deliver efficient solutions using low code
Analyze client’s business, systems, and workflow processes and come up with solutions that meet customer's needs
Carry out solution testing and root-cause analysis to ensure efficient on-boarding processes for new clients and develop logical conclusions and suggest alternative configurations
Assist with assigned customer projects, ensuring timely and efficient communication and solutions are delivered to plan
Coordinate and execute testing, in concert with customers to ensure successful implementation.
Develop, configure, enhance, and administer a variety of QuickBase applications
Identify and build integrations with other business tools/applications to optimize processes
Build reports and dashboards for end-users and management
Develop custom forms and pages and workflow designs
Develop, automate, and maintain data feeds using scripting languages into and out of the application(s)
Collaborate closely with cross-functional stakeholders to develop ideal business processes and automate manual work
Assist staff training for QuickBase Applications and ETL procedures.
Continuous documentation of application configuration, customization, and integration

Education:
Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related fields.

Do you have what It takes?
STRONG work ethic and a can-do attitude
Must possess strong coding and analytical skills
General knowledge of SQL, HTML or JavaScript preferred
Strong written and verbal communication, project management and interpersonal skills.
Must be detail oriented with an inquisitive ability for problem solving.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Ability to prioritize multiple assignments, work independently and take initiative on assigned projects.
Strong sense of urgency and responsiveness

This position is part-time, about 20-25 hours per work, based upon the candidate’s availability. This can be a full remote position, or this person could be based in our Newport, KY office.

At DMG: we exist to provide uninterrupted peace of mind for our customers and for each other. All the way, every day. If you have the courage to hold yourself accountable, if you can help drive our growth by identifying new customers and opportunities (within the account), maintaining, and servicing valued ones, and achieving strategic goals to benefit your bottom line and ours, if you want to work in a fast-paced, positive environment, you WILL be rewarded.
No limits. No excuses.

Divisions Maintenance Group is an equal opportunities employer

Full Job Description
Originally formed as Williamson County Municipal Utility District No. 2 in 1977, Brushy Creek Municipal Utility District provides water and wastewater services, recreational activities and beautiful gardens and parks to the Brushy Creek community. The primary neighborhoods include Brushy Creek North, Sendero Springs, Brushy Creek South, Hillside, the Villages of Brushy Creek, Cat Hollow, the Meadows, the Woods of Brushy Creek and Highland Horizons. Brush Creek employees 175 team members including part-time and seasonal.
Brushy Creek Municipal Utility District has an opening for a paid Information Technology Internship that offers practical work experience, introduction to Windows desktop support and an opportunity to gain experience with the technical operations of a small governmental entity. This internship provides challenging opportunities and interaction with team members to gain knowledge, skills and abilities and hands-on experience, mentor guidance and one-on-one instruction and practicum in the computer field.
The IT intern must be enrolled in a program of study such as a degree or certification program in computer science or information technology, and have a class schedule that allows the student to work 15—20 hours each week for 18 weeks (one semester).
Candidates interested in applying should have foundational knowledge of PC hardware components, desktop operating system software, application software, and foundational knowledge of the PC industry’s current and emerging technology trends and direction. Ideally, candidates should demonstrate interest in computer-based information systems and technology and have the ability to troubleshoot and resolve hardware and software problems.
Preference will be given to candidates who demonstrate skills in oral and written communications, advanced knowledge of web-based platforms, Microsoft Office products, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint and Microsoft operating systems, have advanced skills in customer service, are highly dependable and enjoy being the one who everyone comes to for computer technical help.
Ideally, candidates will be detail-oriented and have the ability to set priorities and manage time effectively. The successful candidate must be able to maintain confidential information on matters of importance.
A background check and drug test will be required.
Apply for this position by downloading and completing the PDF application OR apply online.

Full Job Description
Company Description

Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS) accelerates digital transformation so that customers can be more agile, efficient, resilient, and secure. The Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange is the company’s cloud-native platform that protects thousands of customers from cyberattacks and data loss by securely connecting users, devices, and applications in any location.

With more than 10 years of experience developing, operating, and scaling the cloud, Zscaler serves thousands of enterprise customers around the world, including 450 of the Forbes Global 2000 organizations. In addition to protecting customers from damaging threats, such as ransomware and data exfiltration, it helps them slash costs, reduce complexity, and improve the user experience by eliminating stacks of latency-creating gateway appliances.

Zscaler was founded in 2007 with a mission to make the cloud a safe place to do business and a more enjoyable experience for enterprise users. Zscaler’s purpose-built security platform puts a company’s defenses and controls where the connections occur—the internet—so that every connection is fast and secure, no matter how or where users connect or where their applications and workloads reside.

Job Description

In this role, you will be responsible for hands-on technical research. You will execute proof of concepts for new cloud security features under research for Zscaler’s Cloud Security Posture management product. As a member of the engineering team, you will closely work with the Cloud Policy research team and Cloud Engineering teams to deliver whitepapers. This position will closely work and mentored by Engineering Architect’s.

Responsibilities:
Perform security research on cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Explore the CLOUD API’s and extract vulnerabilities from cloud assets
Penetration testing on cloud solutions and record the successful exploits
Perform proof of concepts to test and design solutions
Develop technical design diagrams for the PoC
Setup a VULS DB ecosystem and integrate with multiple CVE DB in the public
Develop Plugins and Plugins designs for major CI / CD systems

Qualifications

Pursuing Master of Computer Science’s and candidate for graduation in December 2021
You would work 40 hrs/wk during the summer and we are looking for candidates who would be able to work part-time (20 hrs/wk) during the Fall. Conducive to candidates local to San Jose or who will be completing the rest of the Fall 2021 semester virtually
Technical experience in security
Affinity or experience to explore KALI LINUX Tools
Ability to write code in GO or PYTHON
Strong written and verbal communication skills
“Roll up sleeves and do what it takes” attitude and strong team player that is not afraid to present new, creative ideas.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

What You Can Expect From Us:
An environment where you will be working on cutting edge technologies and architectures
A fun, passionate and collaborative workplace
Competitive salary and benefits, including equity

Why Zscaler?

People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.

Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS ) is available at https://www.zscaler.com.

Zscaler is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

position: Summer 2022 Internship Program - IT Audit Internship
description:
Full Job Description
Overview:
With a focus on the Federal Government, Kearney & Company provides financial services, including auditing, consulting, and technology services. Our commitment to our employees and clients as well as to dedication and trust, critical values to our Firm, have led to Kearney’s recognition as one of the leading accounting firms in the country. Based on our employees’ feedback, we are also consistently rated a Best Place to Work. Employment at Kearney means a flexible, collaborative, and open-minded work environment. We hope it is your “first easy decision.” Learn more at www.kearneyco.com/careers.

Responsibilities:
Kearney & Company is seeking students majoring in Accounting and/or Information Systems for our Summer Internship Program. The Kearney & Company Summer Internship Program offers a dynamic experience which includes teamwork on federal client sites (depending on the assignment), the opportunity to contribute to and learn about the workplace, and the chance to build a larger professional network. Participation in Kearney’s Internship Program also includes an Intern led company-wide community service project. Depending on the engagement, there are specific audits that may require travel throughout the United States and the DC metropolitan area.

Additional details about our Internship Program include:
Highly competitive pay
Federal accounting and audit work experience with federal government clients (depending on the assignment)
Week-long Intern Orientation process and training opportunities
8 Week Program with a June start date.
Full Time Status, Monday-Friday 8:30-5:30 (paid for all hours worked)
Opportunities to participate in company-wide events and social activities with Kearney Team Members
Mentor Program

Must currently be in Junior standing in an accredited college/university working towards a BA/BS degree in Accounting, Information Systems, Accounting and Information Systems, Computer Science, Information Technology, and/or Business Administration with a concentration in Accounting
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
CPA candidate or eligibility to sit for CPA certification is highly desirable

Full Job Description
ARA is seeking a Technical Intern to join our team in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. We are a 100% employee-owned scientific research and engineering company dedicated to solving critical national problems to improve our safety, security, and way of life. You will work with other developers and engineers to design and develop products for a diverse range of clients. As a member of our development team, you will work in an agile environment focused on delivering high-quality software to our clients.

One internship is available for a qualified undergraduate or graduate student studying towards a career in software development. The possibility of a transition to full-time employment is possible. Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.

Up to 40 hours/week (during summer) and reduced hours (20 to 30 hours/week) during the school year (dependent upon available work). ARA’s interns are valued members of the team, tasked with work that is critical to the success of our projects.

What We Do

Our software development projects involve:
Designing, developing, and debugging applications in C#, Java, or JavaScript
Frontend frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue
Performing code analysis and review
Designing and implementing graphical user interfaces
Unit testing
Documenting software functionality
Software support after release

Basic Qualifications

Pursuing a Bachelor of Science or higher in Computer Science or related field
Some knowledge (or relevant coursework) of agile development methods
Some knowledge (or relevant coursework) of C#, Java, or JavaScript
Solid oral and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively in small team settings

Preferred Qualifications

Familiarity with relational databases and SQL
Experience (or relevant coursework) with a frontend framework (React, Angular, or Vue)
Understanding of responsive web design
Experience (or relevant coursework) with AWS services

Required

position: Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please
description:
Full Job Description
My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1).
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

#21-00377-Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer-Full Time-No C2C or Visas-No Interns/Trainees Please.

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):

Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4

Our Software Engineer Intern will be an entrepreneurially-minded student or recent grad that will assist in building our supply-side marketing efforts from the ground up. This individual will be a self-starter with a deep passion and excitement for technology, growth hacking, engineering and marketing. They will be someone who has creative ideas, is comfortable wearing many different hats, loves problem solving, has an iterative mindset, and can drive toward measurable, data-driven results. This will either be a part time or full time internship depending on availability of the candidate.
What you'll do...
Work closely with the Product Marketing Manager to analyze complex data sets and develop complex tools that assist with marketing automations
Make suggestions to improve upon our existing data analytics infrastructure to target supply, provide sales and marketing support with existing systems, and develop training playbooks

Assist in interpreting data using statistical techniques and maintaining databases
Assist in tracking campaign effectiveness through reporting, putting together recommendations, and optimizing results
Assist with collecting and analyzing sales and marketing data to develop and adjust correlating marketing plans
Assist with automating data collection and content creation
Assist in the development and implementation of lead scoring and lead ranking strategies
What you'll bring...
Strong interest in engineering, computer science or statistics
Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree (in progress or recently completed)
Strong interest in data analytics, computer science, computational science, and other quantitative skills using SQL and Python

Creative and analytical mind with a strong results-oriented, metrics-driven approach to problem solving
Excellent oral and written communication skills

Team bonding and Company events
Complimentary and discount stays at AvantStay properties
Dog-friendly office (whether you're remote or able to come into our office)

You’ll be doing work that matters alongside an experienced and dynamic team, transforming the way people travel and vacation. Your place within the colossal travel and real estate industries will leave you with a wealth of opportunities to feel both challenged to innovate and rewarded for your efforts. AvantStay is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at AvantStay.

Come work, learn and innovate for an amazing tech company located in NYC.

Gesture is on a mission to modernize and simplify gifting for consumers and B2B customers, while providing a great logistics experience and service for merchants and vendors. We are one of the newest on-demand companies on the market, we live out our company vision by helping to provide the solution to the age-old problem of overpriced and disappointing “gifting experiences.”

Gesture also has one of the most sophisticated logistics systems available in the on-demand industry which provides our vendors and merchants access to our G-Runners / fleet.

Gesture is a fun to use social consumer and B2B gifting logistics platform designed to make sending flowers, wine, champagne and more, as easy and safe as sending a Venmo. No address needed, on-demand, it’s gifting reinvented.

If you are looking to learn and/or expand your current knowledge skill set as a UI/UX (Graphic Design) Intern, we encourage you to apply to our EOIP (Early Opportunity Internship Program).

This internship program has a minimum twelve (12) week duration.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn how to, and turn our current projects into an easy-to-use product for our users
  • Learn how to, and work directly with the creative, tech and marketing teams to understand user requirements, design graphic elements and build navigation components
  • Learn how to, and create both functional and appealing features that address our clients’ needs and help us grow our customer base
  • Learn how to, and brainstorm and collaborate with the product (SKU), creative, tech and marketing teams to come up with UI ideas for mobile applications and websites.
  • Learn how to, and produce UI/UX design solutions through visual and graphic designs, wireframes, flow diagrams, prototypes, etc.
  • Learn how to, and conduct user research and user interview and assisting in user experience design requirements for our suite of digital assets
  • Learn how to, and develop and conceptualize a comprehensive UI/UX design for the brand.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Portfolio of design projects *Please include your portfolio in the application (e.g., link, attachment)*
  • Knowledge of wireframe tools, e.g., Wireframe.cc and InVision, and web design/development
  • Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Figma, Miro, Adobe Illustrator, and Photoshop
  • Understanding of e-commerce business and platforms (app, websites, dashboards, etc.)
  • Must be currently enrolled in a full-time, degree-seeking program and in the process of obtaining a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or PHD in UI/UX Design, Visual Communication Design, Computer Science, or a related field
  • Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
  • Preferred some demonstrated UI/UX experience from previous internship, work experience, competitions, or academic related projects.
  • Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship program.
  • High levels of creativity, self sufficiency and quick problem-solving capabilities

Gesture has a KPI and Pacesetting culture. As such, we are seeking Sharp, Motivated, High-Performing team members.

We encourage you to visit yourgesture.com at your earliest convenience. Be sure to download our Gesture app.

We look forward to meeting you soon.

Full Job Description

Instructional Design and Technology Intern

No salary * No equity * College credit

Robot Startup is an EdTech company that is manufacturing a robotic kit called MorphBots for students pursuing STEM/robotics education. We are working with several schools around the U.S. to commercialize our robotic kit in 2021. Currently, we are launching the MorphBots Robotic Kit Project with several high schools nationwide to beta test version 1.0.

The Instructional Design and Technology Intern’s responsibilities will include integrating the curriculum and instruction they design with the learning modules the Programming and Arduino team have created. The intern must have experience using Adobe Captivate. Having engineering experience will also help because the learning modules teach students about the electrical, mechanical, and programming aspects of robotics. The most important thing to your success is having a drive for education and a belief that education can make a better world.

Your commitments to this internship include the following:

- This internship is for 4 months and is renewable depending on performance.

- You will sign an NDA (non-disclosure agreement) before beginning internship.

- This is an unpaid virtual internship (meetings held on Microsoft Teams).

- This is primarily for those pursing a degree in Education, math, computer science, engineering, STEM field or a related discipline.

- This internship is meant to give you experience creating, designing, and writing a curriculum for robotics education in grades 7th – 12th.

- Group and individual video conferences will be held weekly discussing strategy, implementation, and reviewing results. Expected workload is 10-15 hours per week.

The benefits of doing this internship with Robot Startup are the following:

- Help bring a revolutionary robotic kit to schools that will motivate more U.S. students to pursue STEM careers in a world.

- Gain valuable experience in game design with Unity, thinking like an entrepreneur, and working with a team.

- Be part of a company that will give low-income schools an opportunity to begin their first robotics class with our MorphBots.

- Contribute to a technology that will change robotics forever because of its completely autonomous self-assembling nature.

As a curriculum designer intern with Robot Startup, your activities will include the following:

- Work with the Programming and Arduino team to design the curriculum to fit with the learning module they are creating.

- Collaborate productively with subject matter experts to ensure educational product has real world application.

- Manage your projects on Trello and be expected to complete your weekly tasks before the Team Meeting.

- Collaborating with several talented people on different teams to align your work with the company vision.

- Excellent organizational, planning and time management skills.

- Advanced attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

- Solid communication skills (written and verbal).

- BS or Masters in Instruction Design and Technology, Education, Engineering, or equivalent

Along with your application, please provide examples of relevant past work using Adobe Captivate. If your portfolio is limited, you may provide a one-page description of any relevant experience or knowledge you think would contribute to this internship, any curriculums you have designed and written in the past will help a lot.

Full Job Description
Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. At Dolby, science meets art, and high tech means more than computer code. As a member of the Dolby team, you’ll see and hear the results of your work everywhere, from movie theaters to smartphones. We continue to revolutionize how people create, deliver, and enjoy entertainment worldwide. To do that, we need the absolute best talent. We’re big enough to give you all the resources you need, and small enough so you can make a real difference and earn recognition for your work. We offer a collegial culture, challenging projects, and excellent compensation and benefits.

The world is changing as we know it. It’s more important than ever that communications and entertainment services are available to users to connect wherever they may be. Here at Dolby, our mission is to enable experiences that transcend expectations and reach the spectacular. We need your creative solutions and diverse thought. The Dolby U internship program offers impactful, project-based work experience in a collaborative, creative environment where you work side by side with industry leaders.

Amplify your insatiable curiosity by implementing real-world solutions that revolutionize how people communicate and how entertainment is created, delivered, and enjoyed worldwide. For any student seeking to gain invaluable expertise through meaningful, personal contributions, we invite you to join us in continuing to design a future where technology meets entertainment!

SUMMARY
Dolby Labs is looking for talented individuals to help develop the next generation of motion picture experiences in Dolby Vision. The Platform Development Team is centered in Sunnyvale, California, and is responsible for delivering industry-leading algorithms and packages for video
compression and color management. Of particular interest is enabling the creation and distribution of motion picture content containing wider color gamut and higher luminance levels far beyond anything that is available today. Above all, we strive to deliver a unique “In Dolby” experience that is immediately obvious to all viewers. Our interns will be conducting a series of testing-related tasks involving research, development and customer support.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Validating algorithm effect from research outcome
Verifying code implementation result between development and research teams
Conducting objective and subjective tests for image outputs
Implementing test automation using scripting language or C/C++
Providing analytical report based on test/verification results

QUALIFICATIONS

Proficient in scripting languages (Python, Ruby, etc.) for testing/analysis-related tasks
Knowledge in C/C++ is desired but not required
Understanding of basic video processing concepts is desired but not required
Experience in analyzing test results and generating statistical reports is desired
Ability to deal with fast-paced, frequent-changing tasks

#21-00377-Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer-Full Time-No C2C or Visas-No Interns/Trainees Please.

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
