Full Job Description
The Public Employment Relations Board (PERB) is seeking to hire a student assistant. The student will learn and assist with fiscal and accounting functions as well as being the primary backup for business services. This position is ideal for gaining an understanding of fiscal operations; law office experience; exposure to state government; and developing skills applicable to an entry-level career.

Conditions of Employment
This is a part-time, temporary, non-benefited, student position. Employment in all positions with University Enterprises, Inc. is dependent upon the mutual consent of University Enterprises, Inc. and the employee. This means that either University Enterprises, Inc. or the employee can, at any time, terminate the employment relationship at will, with or without cause.

Depending on the type of position you are applying for, a pre-employment background check consisting of one or more of the following may be conducted, employment history, professional references, criminal check, educational verification (i.e., degree, license, or official transcript) and physical exam and drug urinalysis test. Applicants will be required to pass required pre-employment checks to the satisfaction of University Enterprises Inc., (UEI) and the hiring Agency or Department.

Work Schedule
Flexible, Monday through Friday from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. Final schedule will be determined by supervisor.

Additional Work Schedule

Student Assistant and Graduate Assistant employees generally work up to 20 hours per work week (Sunday – Saturday) during the academic year and up to 40 hours per work week during breaks; Winter, Spring & Summer.

Student Assistants are not permitted to telecommute or work remotely.

Area Sacramento
On/Off Sacramento State Campus Off Campus
Worksite City Sacramento
Pay Range $14.00 - $15.50 per hour
Department/Agency Public Employment Relations Board (PERB)
Unit/Division Administration
Project Description
The Public Employment Relations Board (PERB or Board) is a quasi-judicial administrative agency charged with administering the eight collective bargaining statutes that govern California public sector labor management relations. To learn more visit www.perb.ca.gov.

Majors/Fields of Study Business Administration, Accounting, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Information Systems, Civil Engineering, Computational Analysis, Computer Science and Engineering, Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Engineering, Government , Law, Public Policy and Administration
Minimum Qualifications
  • Minimum 2.95 grade point average.
  • Experience with Microsoft Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
  • Ability to learn new applications/software systems effectively and efficiently.
  • Knowledge of financial analysis and reporting methodologies.
  • Knowledge of basic accounting principles, including generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).
  • Strong organization skills with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks.
  • Ability to process requests consistently with high level of accuracy.
  • Ability to prioritize problems and promptly resolve or escalate when necessary.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with and collaborate with peers and other staff as needed.
  • Ability to provide excellent customer service to internal staff and external constituents.
  • Strong time management skills and ability to manage individual assignments and complete duties within tight deadlines.
  • Ability to independently complete tasks with minimal supervision.
  • Requires the ability to work with and maintain confidential information.
Prerequisites
Must be a college student attending classes during the regular term (Fall, Spring and Winter, if applicable), at one of the accredited colleges or universities on our affiliation list.

To view our current affiliation list please paste the following URL into your browser: http://www.calinterns.org/wp-content/uploads/Affiliation_List.pdf

Students must be enrolled at a minimum in; six semester units or nine quarter units for undergraduate students; four semester units or six quarter units for graduate students.

Students declared major must match the major(s) listed in the job posting.
Preferred Qualifications
Duties and Responsibilities
  • Work with program and project managers to develop the organizations budget.
  • Utilize Excel and Visio to track pertinent data.
  • Review budget proposals for completeness, accuracy, and compliance with State laws, rules, and regulations.
  • Develop and apply skills in all areas of fiscal operations such as accounts payable, travel expense claims, receivables, accounting reports, budget development, budget projections and reconciliation.
  • Develop and maintain reports and logs using Excel.
  • Research and develop internal processes, forms, and reports to contribute towards operational improvement.
  • Special projects applicable to coursework and career interests.
  • Assist with business services functions as needed.
  • Perform document remediation on PERB Board Decisions for compliance with AB 434, ADA accessibility requirements.
Physical Requirements
Sit for extended periods; frequently stand and walk; manual dexterity and hand-eye coordination; corrected hearing and vision to normal range; verbal communication; use of office equipment including computer workstations, telephones, calculators, copiers, printers and scanners; use of basic tools and ability to lift/move up to 40 lbs. with or without a reasonable accommodation.

Working Conditions
PERB is located in a great mid-town location with a wide variety of restaurants and ideal for public transportation. Street and lot parking are available, but at the cost of the intern.

Work is performed in an office environment.

Hours Per Week Students (part-time) 0-20 hours per week during the academic year, up to 40 hours per week during breaks; (Winter, Spring and Summer). (NSTU)

Closing Date 08/22/2021
Open Until Filled No

Please complete all fields of the employment application. Include your educational history in the “Educational Experience” section and any employment history in the “Employment Experience” section of our application. Must submit resume, cover letter, and unofficial transcript.

HR Directions seeks a prospect for its client RTI International for the Technology Full Stack Programming Internship within Global Technology Solutions business unit.

RTI's Internship Program emphasizes experiential and mentored learning experiences, providing students and recent degree recipients an opportunity to apply their academic knowledge and skills in a meaningful and practical way. We are committed to developing the future workforce by encouraging interns to explore various career paths in a nonprofit research institute setting that values diversity and inclusion. Through this program, interns will be exposed to RTI's open and educational culture; support RTI's mission to improve the human condition; and build upon their career goals.

This paid virtual internship will take place from August 2021 through December 2021. The internship requires a minimum commitment of 15 hours per week. Hours are flexible during business hours, Monday through Friday.

Team player, but with the ability to work independently, while aligning work with other team members.

Full Job Description
MAKE A DIFFERENCE AT OCHIN!

OCHIN is a rapidly growing national nonprofit health IT organization with two decades of experience transforming health care delivery to drive health equity. We are hiring for a number of new positions to meet increasing demand. When you choose to join OCHIN, you have the opportunity to continuously grow your skills and do meaningful work to help fulfill our mission.

OCHIN provides leading-edge technology, data analytics, research, and support services to more than 500 community health care sites, reaching nearly 6 million patients nationally. We believe that every individual, no matter their race, ethnicity, background, or zip code, should have fair opportunity to achieve their full health potential. Our work addresses differences in health that are systemic, avoidable, and unjust. We partner, learn, innovate, and advocate, in order to close the gap in health for individuals and communities negatively impacted by racism or other structural inequities.

At OCHIN, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of every individual and work hard to maintain a culture of belonging.

Founded in Oregon in 2000, OCHIN employs a growing virtual workforce of more than 500 diverse professionals, working remotely across 40+ states. We offer a generous compensation package and are committed to supporting our employees’ entire well-being by fostering a healthy work-life balance and equitable opportunity for professional advancement. We are curious, collaborative learners who strive to live our values everyday: leadership, collaboration, excellence, innovation, inclusion, and stewardship. OCHIN is excited to support our continued national expansion and the increasing demand for our innovative tools and services by welcoming new talent to our growing team.

Position Overview

We have an excellent paid internship opportunity available for current college students who are majoring in Information Technology, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field of study. The IT Service Desk Intern will perform general administration and technical duties required to support activities and operations of the Information Technology Service Desk. This is a temporary position working 30 hours per week for one year. This is an hourly paid position at $15 per hour for undergrad and $16 per hour for graduate level students.Training will be provided by OCHIN.

Essential Duties

Performs service desk functions, responds to ticket inquiries, records, documents, and troubleshoots customer issues.
Performs duties associated with setup, configuration and installation of system software products and peripheral equipment.
Programs and troubleshoots computer software and hardware. Identifies, logs, and resolves problems related to supported applications.
Assists in analyzing, evaluating, and recommending techniques for implementation of new software applications and computer equipment.
Assists in updates and maintenance of technology used by OCHIN Staff
Performs all other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Must be currently enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s or master’s degree program.
Experience working with IT, customer support or technical support.
Must have the ability to interact professionally and effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization.
Excellent written and oral communication skills and experience with superior attention to detail.
Experience with MS Office Suite, some knowledge of Smartsheet, Microsoft Teams & Zoom
Experience thriving in a fast-paced environment.

Work Location and Travel Requirements

This position is 100% remote. Work from home requirements are:
Ability to work independently and efficiently from a home office environment
High Speed Internet Service
It is a requirement that employees work in a distraction free workplace
Travel may be required based on business requirements for OCHIN

Equal Opportunity Statement

OCHIN is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills for the benefit of our staff, our mission, and the communities we serve.

As an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, OCHIN, Inc. does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, marital or civil union status, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other protected characteristics. All aspects of employment are based on merit, performance, and business needs.

Input, understand, analyze and act on data

Detail-oriented.

Successful candidates will have basic knowledge of Object Oriented Design Methodologies, basic software development skills including but not limited to, familiarity with C# .NET and/or Java, JavaScript, Web Development, MS SQL Server, and the ability to focus on commitments in an agile development environment.
This position is a great opportunity to learn while making a contribution:

Work with experienced developers to align with and understand overall technical vision for projects, programs, or systems.
Gain understanding about cross-functional impacts, integrations across the organization and architecture rationalization.
Learn & execute on how technical issues and risks are identified, then actively mitigated and resolved.
Work closely with business & IT stakeholders, Senior Developers, and Architects to design and document application/automation solutions that align with the business needs consistent with the architectural vision.
Provide development, testing support, follow implementation of standards, and best practices in alignment with our architecture patterns.
Ensure quality of solution delivery.
Properly document software solutions.
Actively learn on projects about the business unit’s purpose, and how they deliver value to the overall enterprise.
Develop good analytical skills to understand root cause of issues.
Input, understand, analyze and act on data
Identify opportunities to reduce total cost of ownership in the operational application support areas.

Required Qualifications
Student pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related field.
Experience developing C# .Net and/or Java applications
Strong understanding of Object Oriented design and methodologies.
Demonstrate business and technical acumen for applications.
Strong problem solving and analysis skills.
Demonstrated ability to complete tasks within established timelines.
Strong relationship building skills.
Exceptional Communication skills - written and verbal.
Detail-oriented.
Live within a commutable distance to the Windsor office.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with Microsoft SQL Server preferred.

Full Job Description
No Relocation Assistance Offered
# 109820 - Piscataway, New Jersey, United States

The Experience

Colgate-Palmolive invites you to apply for the Fall 2021 Application & Software Development Internship for the Global Information Technology (GIT) organization. Our program provides Interns with the opportunity to work with a global and diverse workforce as well as apply their conceptual knowledge of business and technical skills within a global consumer products company. Throughout our program, Interns will gain valuable work experience and exposure to the latest business practices and groundbreaking technologies. Additionally, Interns will function as integral team members throughout the development life cycle by working with business and technical analysts to evaluate issues, develop solutions, implement processes, and support existing applications.

Essentially, the program is a structured education strategy integrating the students’ academic knowledge and career goals with learning through productive work experiences in a sphere related specifically to Global Information Technology. In this 6-month program, you will join the Global Technology team and work on a few applications supporting our Clinical and Claims business processes including the interface between our Claims system and our Data Warehouse, our Clinical electronic data capture tool, and an interface to provide package content to our artwork suppliers. All of these solutions will be hosted on GCP and written using a combination of Python and JavaScript.

Who are you?

You are a collaborator- In this role, Interns get opportunities to network with multiple cross-functional teams. These relationships flourish with mutual trust and integrity to achieve deliverables and execute against the strategy and goals.

You are an innovator- You look for opportunities to improve and seek creative solutions and you’re able to adapt and adjust the strategy and direction of your work if necessary.

You are curious- You’re curious about what works and what does not and are willing to take the initiative to find out.

What you’ll need (requirements)

Must currently be enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program at a college or university

Majoring in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Business/ IT Systems Management, or a related field

A minimum GPA of 2.8

Documentation of authorization to work in the United States, not requiring visa sponsorship now or in the future

Technical knowledge and skills, completed course work, projects, or relevant work related experience

Must be available to work a minimum of 15-20 hours per week

Familiarity with Python and JavaScript programming languages and web-related technologies

Equal Opportunity Employer
Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.

Are you interested in working for Colgate-Palmolive? You can apply online and attach all relevant documents such as a cover letter and resume or CV. Applications received by e-mail are not considered in the selection process. Become part of our team. We look forward to your application.

Colgate-Palmolive is a leading global consumer products company, tightly focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition. Colgate sells its products in over 200 countries and territories around the world under such internationally recognised brand names as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, Tom’s of Maine, Sorriso, Speed Stick, Lady Speed Stick, Softsoap, Irish Spring, Protex, Sanex, Elta MD, PCA Skin, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Science Diet and Hill’s Prescription Diet.

For more information about Colgate’s global business, visit the Company’s web site at http://www.colgatepalmolive.com. To learn more about Colgate Bright Smiles, Bright Futures® oral health education programme, please visit http://www.colgatebsbf.com. To learn more about Hill's and the Hill’s Food, Shelter & Love program please visit http://www.hillspet.com. To learn more about Tom’s of Maine please visit http://www.tomsofmaine.com.

Reasonable accommodation during the application process is available for persons with disabilities. Please contact Application_Accommodation@colpal.com with the subject "Accommodation Request" should you require accommodation.

Full Job Description
Anduril is a defense technology company, bringing Silicon Valley talent and funding to the defense sector. Our technology helps our customers solve their toughest challenges by enabling them to make better, more informed decisions in life-and-death situations. We’ve assembled a diverse team of experts in artificial intelligence, computer vision, sensor fusion, optics, and data analysis that are creating software and hardware solutions to radically evolve the capabilities of the United States and our allies. If you are passionate about solving problems that have real impact, come join Anduril and build the future of defense.

As a Software Engineer Intern, you will be working alongside a team of engineers with a diverse set of backgrounds and skills. Anduril has a collaborative culture with plenty of opportunities for ownership. As a member of the team, your decisions today will have a large impact on the company now and into the future, as well as our customers. We believe that simple systems are easier to understand, maintain, and scale. You will be making trade-offs as you work to ensure that our systems are prepared to scale - so being able to effectively communicate these trade-offs with your teammates is a must.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Engineers are responsible for the full product lifecycle, including design, implementation, deployment, and maintenance.
Collaborate with cross-functional internal hardware & software teams to incorporate their innovations and vice versa.
Take feedback to iterate on and improve Anduril’s software systems.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Prior engineering internship experience, along with current academic pursuits & studies in the areas of: Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics.
Approaching Junior year or beyond at the time of the internship.
Familiarity with algorithms, data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.
Proficiency in a variety of programming languages such as Go, Java, C++, Python, JavaScript, etc.
A desire to work on software and applications that have real-world impact.
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Have a bias for action. If you see a problem, you want to solve and fix it.
Be naturally curious about the technologies and tools you use.
Have a point-of-view, but are still low-ego.
Anduril is an equal-opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you are someone passionate to work on problems that matter, we’d love to hear from you!

position: Software Engineering: Intern Opportunities for Candidates Engaged with Microsoft Sponsored Organizations
description:
Full Job Description
Applicants who are members or participants of the following Microsoft sponsored organizations or events are encouraged to apply to this posting.

Other (please indicate on your resume)

If you are interested in Software Engineering Roles at Microsoft but are not associated with one of the above organizations, please apply to Job Number: 1085294

Every year, we welcome thousands of university students from every corner of the world to join Microsoft. You bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.

At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passions and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology. The internship is designed not only for you to do great work with the opportunity to learn and grow, but to experience our culture full of diverse community connection, executive engagement, and memorable events.

We’re a company of learn-it-alls rather than know-it-alls and our culture is centered around embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Does this sound like you? Learn more about our cultural attributes.

Are you ready to join us and create the future? Come as you are, do what you love—start your journey with us today!

Responsibilities

Software engineers (SWEs) work with teammates to solve problems and build innovative software solutions. You are passionate about customers and product quality, and you provide technical guidance to Program Managers as they consider user needs and product requirements. You will also be expected to demonstrate an ability to learn and adopt relevant new technologies, tools, methods and processes to leverage in your solutions. As a SWE, you are dedicated to design, development and testing of next-generation software which will empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more.

Applies engineering principles to solve complex problems through sound and creative engineering.
Quickly learns new engineering methods and incorporates them into his or her work processes.
Seeks feedback and applies internal or industry best practices to improve his or her technical solutions.
Demonstrates skill in time management and completing software projects in a cooperative team environment.
Qualifications
Pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree in engineering, computer science or related field.
Must have at least one additional quarter/semester of school remaining following the completion of the internship.
One year of programming experience in an object-oriented language.
Ability to demonstrate an understanding of computer science fundamentals, including data structures and algorithms.

Visit our Careers FAQ Page to learn more about the interview process and answers to commonly asked questions.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Full Job Description
Company: FedEx Services
Job Title: Intern Information Technology- Remote
Job Requisition Number: RC398156
Category: Intern
Pay Type: Non-exempt

Uniontown, Ohio 44685
United States

Colorado Springs, Colorado 80921

The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range or starting rate of candidates hired in Colorado. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, your remote work location (for remote postings), how many years of experience you have, and comparison to other employees already in this role.

This is a 10-week assignment for students pursuing a college degree. Assignments are directly related to intern's academic degree. Under direct supervision, performs duties as assigned. Student participates in a number of organized events providing visibility into the overall operations of FedEx.

Minimum Qualifications:
High School graduate or equivalent. Student has completed at least two years towards a college degree. Completion of a undergraduate degree OR enrollment as undergraduate or graduate student in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Business Analytics, Management, Finance, Economics, Information Security/Science/Technology, Information Systems, Engineering, Statistics, or other related major.

Position Information

Operating an extensive global computer network, the FedEx Services IT department contains approximately 5,000 professionals. IT positions range from highly technical to more business-focused, including but not limited to the following:

Application Development and Support

Business Analyst

Business Intelligence

Compliance

Computer Engineering

Computer Science

Customer Technology Consultant

Data Analytics

Data Engineering

Data Modeling

Data Privacy

Data Science

Database Administration

Development

Information Security (Cybersecurity)

Fraud Identification and Modeling

Governance

IT Architecture

Policy Management

Project Management

Regulatory Analysis

Risk Management

Supply Chain

System Administration

Systems Support

Technical Analysis

Full-time internship opportunity from September 2021 to November 2021. This position can be domiciled in multiple areas across the US. This job posting is multiple areas within IT.

Business Analyst and Project Management-Focused Roles

Under close supervision, the successful candidate may assist with technology industry research, global business intelligence, and emerging trends analysis. Work may also include analysis of specific business metrics and research/analysis of data, industry trends, and market information. The project may relate to a mobile app, geo-fencing, revenue systems, or another initiative. Individuals will work either on a team of 4-6 interns or on individual project assignments.

The successful candidate may assist with one or more of the following:

Conduct data analytics, report development, and/or research for FedEx IT initiatives.

Interact with business partners and/or IT staff to gather, plan, design, implement, and document software requirements for a FedEx IT project matched to business needs, systems functions, and business process flows.

Address customer problems or requests for information on customer automation systems, FedEx software and/or FedEx deployed technologies.

Analyze business needs, implement customer solutions and provide technical product support.

Measuring and analyzing trends and validating need for process changes to maintain optimum customer support and satisfaction.

Support Information Security governance, risk management and compliance processes.

Assist with monitoring and reporting of internal compliance against external regulations and industry standards.

Assist with performance of risk assessments, oversight and enforcement activities to meet enterprise-wide information security requirements.

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience:

Business and project/program management skills; organizational skills; ability to manage multiple tasks, set priorities and monitor ongoing results; leadership skills.

Basic knowledge of one or more of the following: the software development process, systems applications and architecture, networking, Query Languages, “R,” MATLAB, Python, C++, objective-C, C#, Swift, Java, iOS/Android Mobile development, and SQL.

Analytical and research skills; knowledge and/or experience with statistics or big data and report design/development.

Knowledge or experience with one or more of the following: data analytics, forecasting/modeling, strategy planning, and project management.

Experience in analytical/quantitative business, operations, or economics; coursework or experience in global studies.

Ability to synthesize large volumes of data (quantitative and qualitative).

Ability to solve business and technical customer-related issues.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills; presentation skills; knowledge of PowerPoint or Prezi and the Office suite.

Technical Roles

Under close supervision, the successful candidate will apply modern technology to assist with development of computer programs and applications for real-world FedEx business initiatives.

Projects may involve mobile applications, web development, Quality Assurance testing automation, big data platforms, revenue systems, and/or architecture development. Technologies used may include Tibco, Hibernate, ICEFACES, Ab Initio, Hadoop, Platfora, Spotfire, Java/J2EE & related frameworks, JMS, JavaScript, HTML5, .Net, C, C++, C#, Oracle, Weblogic, JBOSS, JDBC, subversion, and/or Query Languages such as PL/SQL.

The candidate may complete root cause analysis as well as test, document, and implement IT projects for FedEx IT initiatives. Individuals may also perform database design, database support, and systems enhancements. Individuals will work either on a team of 3-6 interns or on individual project assignments.

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience:

Solid foundation in computing

Knowledge and/or experience with one or more of the following: Java/J2EE & related frameworks, JMS, JavaScript, HTML5, .Net, C, C++, C#, Oracle, SharePoint, Weblogic, JBOSS, JDBC, subversion, and/or Query Languages such as PL/SQL.

Knowledge and/or experience with one of the following: system administration, systems applications, systems architecture, database administration, and technical requirements analysis.

Familiarity with Unix, Linux or Windows administration and scripting.

Familiarity with designing and evaluating IT solutions.

Hardware and software technical background.

Experience in IT or Information Security.

Strong analytical and communication skills, including technical writing.

Basic understanding of business principles and project management.

Strong attention to detail and ability to complete large volumes of work efficiently and effectively.

The following are considered a plus:
Enrollment as undergraduate at junior year or above or graduate student in Business, Management, Project Management, Supply Chain, Transportation, Operations, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Business Analysis, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Information Science, Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Computer Information Systems, Network Engineering, Programming, Information Security, Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology, Information Engineering, Business Analysis, Data Structures and Analysis, or other quantitative major.

Ideally, plans to graduate within 12 months of completing the internship and begin full-time employment.

Resume must include the following information:
College address and permanent home address.

Email address.

Telephone number.

The following regarding the degree you are currently pursuing and any previous undergraduate or graduate degrees:

Name of college/university.

Degree (For example, bachelor’s degree, master’s degree, or doctorate).

Major and/or minor.

Overall GPA.

Major GPA.

Date of intended graduation (Month and year).

Domicile Location:
This position can be domiciled in multiple areas across the US.

Relocation assistance not available.

Employee Benefits: medical, dental, and vision insurance; paid Life and AD&D insurance; tuition reimbursement; paid sick leave; paid parental leave, paid vacation, paid military leave, and additional paid time off; geographic pay ranges; 401k with Company match and incentive bonus potential; sales Incentive compensation for selling roles.

FedEx Services is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetics disability, or protected Veteran status.

FedEx Services will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee, unless undue hardship or a direct threat would result from the accommodation. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact recruitmentsupport@fedex.com.

position: Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please
description:
Full Job Description
My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1).
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

#21-00377-Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer-Full Time-No C2C or Visas-No Interns/Trainees Please.

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

3000 N Ocean Drive, S. 5H
Riviera Beach, FL 33404

Full Job Description
Every year, we welcome thousands of university students from every corner of the world to join Microsoft. You bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.

At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passions and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology. The internship is designed not only for you to do great work with the opportunity to learn and grow, but to experience our culture full of diverse community connection, executive engagement, and memorable events.

We’re a company of learn-it-alls rather than know-it-alls and our culture is centered around embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Does this sound like you? Learn more about our cultural attributes.

Are you ready to join us and create the future? Come as you are, do what you love—start your journey with us today!

Responsibilities

Program Managers (PMs) are the in-house advocates for millions of people worldwide who predict and research how software is used and work closely with Software Engineers (SWEs) to ensure our products exceed people's expectations.

Program Managers are typically responsible for specific features in our technology solutions for the full product cycle. You work on the initial feature planning and design, manage the specifications of their development, and monitor their on-going operation to better understand customer experiences. You work collaboratively with teammates to ensure our products exceed customer expectations. You communicate throughout the process to understand progress towards delivery, technical challenges, and to provide clarity on customer needs using a data driven approach. You will be expected to demonstrate an ability to learn and adopt relevant new technologies, tools, methods and processes to leverage in your solutions. As a Program Manager, you are dedicated to building software to empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more.

Qualifications
Currently pursuing bachelor's, master's, or PhD degree in computer science, engineering, or related field with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship.

Full Job Description
Overview:
Shure offers a challenging and rewarding internship program. This internship opportunity is offered to undergraduate students that have completed at least 2 years of college, as well as graduate students. Each intern will receive a competitive salary and students who reside out of Illinois will receive a housing stipend to cover living expenses. Applications will be collected, reviewed and selected candidates will be contacted in late fall/early winter.

As a Data Science Intern, you will work with a team of engineers who research, prototype, implement and demonstrate use cases in machine learning and artificial intelligence that make Shure products smarter, more performant, and more insightful. You will identify and capture datasets that you will use to train and assess predictive models that derive insights from structured and/or unstructured data.

Experience with big data technologies and cloud-based services for data storage and processing
Knowledge of machine learning and deep learning models and frameworks
Knowledge of full stack development with languages such as Python, Java, JavaScript, and C++
Experience with embedded development is desired
Creativity and curiosity for future technologies and a passion for realizing new capabilities

Full Job Description

Media Island is a Digital Marketing agency specializing in the international tourism industry, specifically with Central American tourism agencies. We work on campaigns highly targeted to Miami, FL, and surrounding areas to increase our clients' branding and to improve their client acquisition processes.

We are currently recruiting an intern for a Website Design Internship position with strong experience in web design skills. All student candidates must be currently enrolled in a college, university, or technical school. for the fall 2021 semester. This will be an unpaid internship for college credit.

Candidates should display strong written and verbal communication skills, as well as an eagerness to learn. Bi-lingual in Spanish and English preferred, but not required. You must know how to code, design, and know API integration.

Students will be asked to intern at least twenty-four hours a week but we will do our best to work with your schedule.

Job Description: The Website Design intern will assist in creating the look, layout, and features of our client's websites. The position involves understanding both graphic design and computer programming. The designer helps with maintenance and additions to the website. They work with development teams and managers for keeping the site up-to-date and prioritizing needs, among other tasks.

Prior Experience with the following software is preferred:

· HTML5

· InVision

· Adobe Creative Suite

· WordPress

· JavaScript

· Click Funnels

Skills & Key Qualifications:

  • Cut down our offer creation-to-launch time
  • Data-driven & decisive decision-making skills
  • Ambitious and highly motivated to perform at the highest level
  • Quickly gain a deep understanding of our brand, programs, and clients
  • Prioritizes actions & tests based on the easiest levers to pull with the biggest results
  • Able to quickly generate a responsive & full-stack funnel, with ideal/correct UX & UI
  • In-depth knowledge of Clickfunnels and “Funnel Hacking”
  • Strong understanding of all areas of digital marketing- SEO, Ads placement, email marketing, automation sequences, etc.
  • Create an A/B Testing SOP to test 1 variable per week (minimum) per offer/funnel with reliable tracking metrics (UTMs)
  • Monitors funnel changes, duplications, and tests so that they remain stable throughout the new offer launches and updates to existing funnel flows
  • Able to troubleshoot, identify, and fix any Clickfunnel issues

Requirements

  • Willing to try, not afraid to fail: You need a willingness to learn and master unfamiliar skills. We operate in a unique, non-traditional way and require you to adapt to our operations. We are after learning and embrace that failure is a part of that process.
  • Seeking constant self-improvement: We strive to be an organization where the best ideas succeed. We communicate and operate transparently. We strive for continuous evolution and do not shy from giving honest feedback for the greater good of the organization. You must be open to receiving and giving feedback for the greater good of the company.
  • Work hard, play hard mentality: Our primary responsibility is taking care of our clients. You must be willing to get the job done.
  • Ability to work 24+ hours/week: This will be a remote position.

Qualifications

  • Bachelors degree preferred in Computer Science, Web Design or related fields.
  • 2+ years of prior experience in website design and managing websites.
  • Prior experience at a digital marketing agency.
  • Strong knowledge of social media trends and the competitive landscape of digital marketing.
  • Conversational and written fluency in Spanish is strongly preferred.
  • Excellent time-management, organization, and communication skills.
  • Ability to work effectively under pressure and balance priorities.
  • Strong analytic skills.
  • Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.

The fall 2021 Website Design internship at Media Island is an incredible way to get experience working within a digital marketing agency. All applicants must be available to start as soon as possible.

Full Job Description
DataPath's MaxView Enterprise Network Management System is a powerful solution that enables our customers to see the state of their entire network, control multi-vendor devices, automate complex service tasks, and unify disparate systems into one view.

We are looking for qualified, computer science/engineering intern candidates to join our software teams in support of the development and integration of our MaxView software. A typical Software Intern will rotate through our software teams to get exposure to multiple tools, languages, and frameworks, (including Java, Hibernate, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, OSGI/Knopflerfish, AngularJS, JQuery, Python, Spring, Distributed Services Architecture (DSA) and DSLink, Maven, Eclipse, Netbeans, Tomcat/TomEE and more). Don't worry - you'll learn them as you go.

Our goal is to find candidates and share in the mutual benefits of growing interns into well-trained, well-prepared engineers. Must be available for a full-time intern position. Not conducive to taking courses simultaneously during the intern position.

  • Work alongside our software team to assist with internal and external development and integration projects.
  • Create script-based drivers to interface MaxView with customer hardware.
  • Create UI web pages.
  • Assist with programming tasks directly on the MaxView product.
  • Execute software testing to validate core product enhancements.
The most successful interns will have a strong passion for software development, be critical thinkers, and possess a desire to learn in a fast-paced, team environment. Some experience with software development is required. The position does not include relocation.

Minimum Requirements

  • U.S. Citizenship is required.
  • Basic software programming skills are required.
  • Enrolled in or have completed a Bachelor's/Master's program in Computer Science/Engineering.
  • Requires at least 60% of time onsite so full remote working is not available.
Preferred Requirements:
  • Knowledge of Java, JavaScript, TCL, Groovy, and Web development using HTML 5 and CSS a plus.
  • Self-starter willing to take on projects with minimal guidance.
  • Possess an outgoing personality and a team-first attitude.

Full Job Description
LinkUp is a Minneapolis-based job search engine with a singular vision of delivering perfect job market information to our clients and users. We do this through proprietary and sophisticated technology that allows us to index millions of jobs directly from company websites around the world every day. We’re the global leader in delivering accurate, real-time, and predictive job market data and analytics. Every day we index millions of global job openings directly from employer websites and deliver that data to clients across industries and around the world to help them assess labor demand, understand trends, predict job growth and decline, and so much more.

We are seeking an individual who will be a key contributor to our data management team to support the ongoing growth of the company.

About the role
You'll work as part of a fun team, using your growing skillset to help us scour the internet to build the world's best index of job opportunities and job market data.

Location
Typically, this position is located at our office in downtown Minneapolis with opportunities for remote work. Due to COVID-19, this position may start as work-from-home exclusively. We're currently discussing back-to-office plans, vaccination requirements, and et cetera with clarification to come further along in the process. As such, you'll want to make sure the following are available to you:

A relatively distraction-free environment to work in
Reliable internet connection for working and participating in video meetings

While not strictly required, we're heavily favoring candidates more local to the area. At this time, we cannot facilitate candidates who are international/require a work visa/et cetera. Equipment to work on will be provided to you. For security reasons, you will not be permitted to work from your own PC/laptop/device.

Compensation
This is a paid internship ideal for non-traditional students working on a technical degree. The pay is $20 per hour and planned to be about 20 hours per week. Since this is a part-time internship, the role does not meet the requirements to be benefits-eligible for health/dental benefits, vacation, holiday pay, or 401K plan participation.

Length of Internship
This posting is for a 5–7 month internship position.

To be successful, you'll need the following

Working towards a degree (or equivalent experience) in computer science or related field
Some experience programming in one or more modern programming languages (you'll learn PHP here if you don't already know it)
A baseline understanding of web technologies and protocols
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
The ability to work collaboratively or independently

Someone that would be a great fit

Gets excited about metrics and analytics
Loves to write code and manipulate data
Sees data in everything and wants to take things apart and tinker
Has a natural tendency to automate and streamline things
Has a habit of setting measurable goals and blowing past them
Knows the importance of clean, consistent, documented code
Can read and understand code written by other people
Loves being a critical part of a team doing meaningful work

A little bit about us
We take pride in a great company culture that is based on our core principles: work hard, have fun, think big, solve problems, and do good. To be blunt (and brag a bit), LinkUp is a great company filled with outstanding people that are incredibly talented, extremely dedicated, and really fun to work with. Along with some of our office perks such as stand-up desks, scooters, volunteer opportunities, and free snacks, we offer competitive pay, health / dental benefits, paid time off, 401k, and employee stock options.

description:
Full Job Description
My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1).
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

#21-00377-Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer-Full Time-No C2C or Visas-No Interns/Trainees Please.

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

At POWER Engineers, Inc., you can have a rewarding career on every level. Our Gist:
We are an open API banking platform, focused on creating cutting-edge technology for financial institutions. The platform allows banks the fast and flexible deployment of features that their customers have come to expect—mobile-focused, user-centric, convenient and secure. Join us, and start dreaming of new ways to be at the center of your customers' financial lives. To meet this goal, we're continually seeking future Apiturians to help us build, grow and launch the banking industry in new and innovative ways through the addition of an intern on our corporate engineering team for the Fall semester.
We have this crazy, thrill-seeking goal to revolutionize banking, through an open architecture built natively for the next-generation of serverless, cloud-based technologies, providing financial customers infinite scalability, availability, and transparency. We are moving fast, thinking big, leading strong, and need your leadership to serve on the front lines of the revolution.
We are open to regionally remote applicants for our Internships.

As if waking up every morning to the sand and surf of Carolina beaches and the Cape Fear Riverfront against an azure sky wasn't awe-inspiring enough, we offer an inspired work place, too. We have a beautiful, newly built-out office in mid-town Wilmington, on Live Oak Bank's campus. We offer a very generous compensation and benefits package, onsite gym, social events, and the opportunity to work with some of the smartest and energetic people you'll find anywhere. While you may have never heard of us, rest assured – over four hundred financial institutions and tens of millions of customers rely on us to power some of the most innovative and important pieces in the financial industry. We're backed by some of the biggest and most well-respected names in finance, and we're growing – fast!

Full Job Description
Overview:
An intern position, in the Software Design Group, at General Dynamics Ordnance and Tactical Systems, offers you the opportunity to be continually challenged and immersed in a software design & test environment. Working with software engineers will give you the time to develop your skills and talent in a collaborative environment. You will have access to the latest tools, hardware, and some of the brightest software engineers in this area. If you see yourself as a versatile individual, broadened experiences and a position in Software Engineering are within your control.

We are about supporting the warfighter. We are about developing advanced rotary cannons, high speed ammunition handling systems, gun turrets, crew served weapons and other electro-mechanical technologies. Of which, software is an integral part of our weaponry. Our products can be found with every U.S. military branch and with allies around the world.

You as the latest member of our team will contribute to the design and development of many future military armament systems. Come join our incredible team and know that you will be making a difference in the mission of our warfighter.

Major Position Responsibilities:
Your work will be performed with supervision by a lead engineer or functional management and guided by industry standards and procedures. You will be expected to rapidly develop the skills to perform software support tasks. Dependent on your capabilities, this role can be as challenging as you want it to be.

This position will require you to:
Play an important role in helping develop and implement object-oriented software, in a small software development team environment.
Participate in the testing process through software test development, test execution, and software validation.
Communicate and work with the project team, program, suppliers, customers and functional management.

Experience: No experience is required for this position.

Broad knowledge of software applications.
Has some programming and test validation experience with C/C++
Is familiar with Linux operating system.
Hands-on experience troubleshooting software, hardware and test equipment.

Other Attributes

description:
Full Job Description
Qualifications
Current student pursuing an undergraduate degree related to economics, computer science, information technology, engineering
Experience/exposure to SQL language, Python, Cloud Environments is a plus
Passion for research and data analytics particularly in economics topics
Proficiency in Excel, Alteryx, Tableau or other ETL related software
Superb people skills and strong team orientation
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Inquisitive and investigative nature with a high degree of creativity and self-motivation
Excellent online research skills; ability to recognize reputable sources and to synthesize information from multiple sources
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Spanish
Who You'll Work With
You'll join our San Jose office as part of our Client Capabilities Network for the McKinsey Global Institute. You will assist in a variety of projects in support of our data platform.
Colleagues in our global Client Capabilities Networkdeliver distinctive client impact through assets and expertise and are driven by a culture of innovation.
McKinsey & Company established the McKinsey Global Institute in 1990 as its independent, internal economics research arm. Its mission is two-fold: to achieve breakthrough microeconomic understanding of the most important global macroeconomic issues today, and to generate insights that materially impact the decisions of both corporate leaders and policymakers.
What You'll Do
You will split your time between content development and knowledge management activities in several long-term research investments.
In content development, you will support the experts in the development of new tools and/or the maintenance of current proprietary databases, especially through database structuring, working on workflow processes and reporting (dashboards). In knowledge management, you will help with the development of supporting documentation, dashboards and newsletters.
The internship will last up to 12 months.

Full Job Description
JUNIOR DEVELOPER INTERNSHIP

Motive is a dynamic agency and creative collective operating at the speed of culture. We're a collective of deep thinkers, creative makers, cultural connoisseurs, and executional aces. We create meaningful engagements between brands and their audiences, cultivating relationships that drive tangible results for our clients. And we do it with sharp strategy and powerful creative execution across all the media and touch points key to our targets' lives.

If this sounds like a place you would thrive, let's see if we can make something happen.

ROLE

The Junior Web Developer Intern will work closely with our developers, creatives and the broader account team, to build and maintain digital projects for our growing list of clients. In this role, we're looking for someone with a good foundational knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and an intense desire to learn more. You'll gain valuable experience working on a variety of different projects—from website builds to banner assets to email development to ongoing site updates. We are accepting interns still in school or recent graduates looking for a permanent position. This is a paid internship.

We work in a fast-paced environment where there is always something new to learn, and so much opportunity for growth.

Key Areas of Responsibility:
Work closely with the development team to help build paid media assets for the agencies roster of clients
Maintain existing websites through ongoing updates, optimizations and refreshes
Develop emails for marketing campaigns
Support in the build of websites and promotional landing pages
Work closely with the design team to ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
Research problems discovered in testing or production with a strong sense of ownership and develop solutions to address the problems
Collaborate with the team to stay abreast of emerging technologies and how they can be applied to projects and clients
Support change and help accelerate innovation

Candidate Requirements:
Experience in front-end or full-stack development
Graduate of or currently enrolled in a computer-related major (computer science/engineering)
Experience with developing banner ads and webpages
Experience with HTML5 – Must be very familiar on html tags and the base structure
Understanding and ability to do CSS – Know basic color swaps, font installations, multi column structures, animations, hover over transitions, know how media queries work
Bonus: Possible examples of svg animations, animations on hover, showing a responsive grid for Desktop/Laptop/Tablet/Phone
Basic understanding of Javascript and knowledge on how to install scripts to a document
Desire to be part of a rapidly growing team
Attention to detail and ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously
Knowledge and experience with development tools such as Dreamweaver and Filezilla

Motive is an equal opportunity employer! We believe that a diverse team makes us stronger and smarter.

Motive recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law.

Motive has a clear vision: to be a creative leader where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, to stay and do their best work. We know our company succeeds by the hard work and dedication of our passionate and creative employees.
