position: Frame Design Rule Checking - Fall 2021 Intern
description:
Full Job Description
About GLOBALFOUNDRIES:
GLOBALFOUNDRIES is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GLOBALFOUNDRIES makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. GLOBALFOUNDRIES is owned by Mubadala Investment Company. For more information, visit www.globalfoundries.com .

Summary of Role :
GLOBALFOUNDRIES Fab 8/9/10 Frame Team, which is part of the Tapeout organization, is seeking a talented and motivated person to join the team who is pursuing semiconductor product, design automation or software development skills.

The Tapeout organization is responsible for the successful delivery of photomasks to our wafer fabs. The delivery of photomasks involves several design and computational processes, one of which is the wafer inline process monitoring content (PCM) included in a physical structure known as the Frame which borders our customers designs. Designing of the Frame involves optical, electrical and physical structures that are translated onto each photomask level in parallel with the customers design and mask manufacturing content.

You will primarily be responsible for learning how Frames spanning several different technology nodes incorporate additional content via automation to meet manufacturability criteria and then interpret as well as translate layout design rules into a Mentor Graphics Calibre svrf scripted Frame Design Rule Checking (DRC) tool. Additionally, you may develop documentation as required associated with the DRC enablement. The technologies nodes may include Bulk, SOI, RF CMOS or other differentiated offerings. You will be a member of the broader Global Tapeout Operations team that produces masks encompassing both the Frame and product chip designs. Other tasks may include writing programs using scripting languages to continuously improve the efficiency of generating Frames in a quality manner. A person in this role will have the opportunity to interact with Frame Engineers, Design Manual Owners, Design Rule Engineers, and Design Enablement as well as Process Design Kit (PDK) Engineers. The person in this role must be able to work effectively in a remote learning and work setting as your immediate Manager and your primary Mentor may reside at a different site than you will be located. This position is planned to be located at the GLOBALFOUNDRIES site in Austin, Texas.

The intern will have the opportunity to learn about a semiconductor Foundry’s Frame verification approach as well as at least one Design Rule Checking (DRC) methodology while gaining exposure to industry offered Electronic Design Automation (EDA) tools.

Essential Responsibilities:
Learn how Frames spanning several different technology nodes incorporate additional content via automation
Interpret and translate layout design rules into a Mentor Graphics Calibre svrf scripted Design Rule Checking (DRC) deck
Develop documentation as required associated with the DRC enablement
Write programs using scripting languages to continuously improve the efficiency of generating Frames
Interact with interact with Frame Engineers, Design Manual Owners, Design Rule Engineers, and Design Enablement as well as Process Design Kit (PDK) Engineers
Work effectively in a remote learning and work setting

Other Responsibilities:
Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs

Required Qualifications:
Enrolled in a BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science degree
Experience with Python or Shell Scripting
Experience using Cadence Virtuoso or an equivalent design layout tool
Experience using a Design Rule Checking (DRC) tool, such as Mentor Graphics Calibre
Fluency in English Language – written & verbal
Travel: 0-to-10% Travel required

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience coding a Design Rule Checking (DRC) tool, specifically Mentor Graphics Calibre svrf
Experience using Cadence Quickview or an equivalent design viewing tool
Experience using office productivity software tools (preferably Microsoft products)
Prior experience as an intern in the Semiconductor industry in a related role, such as PDK development or Tapeout with knowledge in related areas such as mask data preparation, inline metrology, reticle construction, testchips, reticle frame building, OPC or mask manufacturing
Familiar with Software Engineering with Programming Languages (Java, Perl) or scripting language (Korn Shell) on a Linux platform or relational database experience
Familiar with programming (React, JSP, Spring Framework, JavaScript/Dojo, LDAP, AJAX, Rest Services, JBoss, CSS and LSF)

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at usaccommodations@globalfoundries.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.

An offer of employment with GLOBALFOUNDRIES is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background check and drug screen, as applicable and subject to applicable laws and regulations.

GLOBALFOUNDRIES is fully committed to equal opportunity in the workplace and believes that cultural diversity within the company enhances its business potential. GLOBALFOUNDRIES goal of excellence in business necessitates the attraction and retention of highly qualified people. Artificial barriers and stereotypic biases detract from this objective and may be illegally discriminatory.

All policies and processes which pertain to employees including recruitment, selection, training, utilization, promotion, compensation, benefits, extracurricular programs, and termination are created and implemented without regard to age, ethnicity, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristic or category specified by local, state or federal law.

Job Summary

The Cyber Security Intern position is an excellent opportunity to contribute to various aspects of cyber security, threat intelligence, vulnerability management, incident response, risk and compliance, identity and access, and security awareness programs at WC Bradley. The Cyber Security Intern will work independently and in a team to support the organizational strategy and assist in maturing W.C. Bradley co. cyber security processes. This is a temporary role with potential to grow into a permanent position.
The Cyber Security Intern helps identify and prevent cyber threats to W.C. Bradley by actively monitoring and maintaining several security related systems such as reviewing and analyzing security alerts, anti-virus alerts, patching and vulnerability scanning reports, and supporting related systems.
Duration of this Internship:

  • Part-time 20 hours per week
  • Remote work will be considered (GA, AL, FL residents only)
  • Position will run through the remainder of 2021 with a potential for permanent hire in 2022

Duties and Responsibilities

Expected Activities:

  • Daily monitoring of security tools to protect sensitive information (anti-virus, patching, firewalls, intrusion detection, etc.) using log correlation tools such as a Security Incident Event Management system (SIEM).
  • Assist with the development and implementation of security standards and best practices
  • Recommend security enhancements
  • Monitor the organization’s networks for security incidents and investigate violations when they occur
  • Assist with the development of IT Security training for company employees
  • Assist with vulnerability scanning and patch management
  • identify and define system security requirements (Networks/Servers/PCs/Web Applications, etc.)
  • Assist with the configuration of security infrastructure devices
  • Assist with developing technical solutions and research security tools to help enhance IT security
  • Assist with detecting, responding, and recovering from security-related incidents and events
  • Recommend and assist with developing automation through scripting/coding
  • Examines malware and malicious scripts
  • Administers logical access controls and performs recurring entitlement reviews
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualification Requirements

Candidate Requirements:

  • Currently enrolled as a Junior or Senior in a Bachelor of Science degree program for computer science or related field
  • Advanced knowledge of Information Technology
  • Foundational understanding of basic security concepts like encryption, separation of duties, and malware, intrusion detection
  • Some familiarity with security best practices and industry standards (e.g. NIST, ISO, CIS, COBIT, OWAP, etc.)
  • Ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities
  • Must be at-least eighteen years of age
  • Must be able to pass pre-employment background check and drug screening

About Us

PrizePicks is the largest independently owned Daily Fantasy Sports (DFS) platform in North America. Centered around real-money over/under predictions, PrizePicks allows sports fans to play against the numbers rather than each other, and it is the simplest variety of daily fantasy sports with the widest breadth of sports coverage of any DFS operator. Boasting partnerships to date with the Atlanta Braves, Atlanta Falcons and Miami Marlins, among others, PrizePicks is currently the closest legal alternative to legal mobile sports betting in the majority of the United States including Top 10 markets like California, Texas, Florida, and Georgia. With an existing digital footprint covering more than 60 percent of the U.S. population, PrizePicks is the most accessible type of game for the masses. The company is headquartered in Atlanta, and PrizePicks is the third product from Performance Predictions, a suite of fan engagement solutions including SidePrize, the 2016 Fantasy Sports and Gaming Association's "Rookie of the Year" award recipient. PrizePicks is available in the App Store and Google Play or at prizepicks.com

description:
Full Job Description
My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1).
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

#21-00377-Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer-Full Time-No C2C or Visas-No Interns/Trainees Please.

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Full Job Description
The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) is the leading global environmental authority that sets the global environmental agenda, promotes the coherent implementation of the environment sustainable development within the United Nations system and serves as an authoritative advocate for the global environment. UNEP is the United Nations system's designated entity for addressing issues at the global and regional level. The internship position is located in the UNEP/New York Office.

The internship is for a period of six (6) months. It is unpaid and full-time. Interns will work five days (35-40 hours) per week
The Internship is UNPAID and full-time.
Interns work five days per week (35-40 hours) under the supervision of a staff member in the department or office to which they are assigned.

In the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, applicants may be requested to undertake the internship remotely in view of constraints regarding visa issuance, international travel and access to UN premises. Applicants must be willing and prepared to undertake the internship remotely for a part or the entirety of the internship. The work hours during the internship shall be determined based on individual discussion between the intern and the supervisor(s) taking into consideration the minimum requirements of the Organization and the time difference between the hosting office and the location of the intern.

Responsibilities

Under the supervision of the Head of Communications, New York Office, the intern will:

  • Curate and produce digital content on UNEP New York events and special events for UNEP New York social media channels, including articles on news related to the work of UNEP in New York, multimedia for use in connection with social media posts to boost UNEP New York’s visibility and reach
  • Assist in producing communication products for events organized by UNEP in New York including and not limited to infographics, flyers, posters, banners, videos and others
  • Assist in planning and organization of key UN Environment events and activities in UN Headquarters
  • Ensure that UNEP New York website is updated regularly with new stories and events
  • Assist with outreach and media for events organized by UNEP in New York, including the organization of press briefings and conferences
  • When required, attend and summarize key discussions on meetings at UN Headquarters, including meetings organized by the Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC), Security Council and UN missions in New York.
Competencies

Communication:
  • Speaks and writes clearly and effectively
  • Listens to others, correctly interprets messages from others and responds appropriately
  • Asks questions to clarify, and exhibits interest in having two-way communication
  • Tailors language, tone, style and format to match the audience
  • Demonstrates openness in sharing information and keeping people informed
Teamwork:
  • Works collaboratively with colleagues to achieve organizational goals
  • Solicits input by genuinely valuing others’ ideas and expertise; is willing to learn from others
  • Places team agenda before personal agenda
  • Supports and acts in accordance with final group decision, even when such decisions may not entirely reflect own position
  • Shares credit for team accomplishments and accepts joint responsibility for team shortcomings
Client Orientation:
  • Considers all those to whom services are provided to be “clients ” and seeks to see things from clients’ point of view
  • Establishes and maintains productive partnerships with clients by gaining their trust and respect
  • Identifies clients’ needs and matches them to appropriate solutions
  • Monitors ongoing developments inside and outside the clients’ environment to keep informed and anticipate problems
  • Keeps clients informed of progress or setbacks in projects
  • Meets timeline for delivery of products or services to client
Education

Applicants must at the time of application meet one of the following requirements:

(a) be enrolled in a graduate school programme in journalism, communication, media studies, information technology, political science, international relations, analytics or related field (second university degree or equivalent, or higher); or
(b) be enrolled in the final academic year of a first university degree programme in journalism, communication, media studies, information technology, political science, international relations, analytics or related field (minimum Bachelor’s level or equivalent); or
(c) have graduated with a university degree in communication, media studies, journalism, information technology, political science, international relations, analytics or related field (as defined in (a) or (b) above).

Be computer literate in standard software applications.

Have demonstrated keen interest in the work of the United Nations and have a personal commitment to the ideals of the Charter;

Have a demonstrated ability to successfully interact with individuals of different cultural backgrounds and beliefs, which include willingness to try and understand and be tolerant of differing opinions and views.

Work Experience

No working experience is required to apply for the United Nations Internship Programme. Your training, education, advance course work or skills should benefit the United Nations during your internship.
Experience in summarizing and writing documents related to environmental issues is highly desirable

Languages

English and French are the working languages of the United Nations Secretariat. For this internship fluency in oral and written English is required. Knowledge of another UN language is an advantage.
NOTE: "Fluency equals a rating of "fluent" in all four areas (read, write, speak, understand) and "Knowledge of" equals a rating of "confident" in two of the four areas.

Assessment

Potential candidates will be contacted by hiring manager directly for further consideration.

Special Notice

Your application for this internship must include:
1.A Completed application (Personal History Profile) and Cover Note, through the UN careers Portal. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.

The Cover Note must include:
  • Title of the degree you are currently pursuing
  • Graduation Date
  • IT skills and programmes you are proficient in
  • Explain why you are the best candidate for this specific internship
Explain your interest in the United Nations Internship Programme, ensure to include all past work experience (if any).

2. Proof of enrollment from current University (if not graduated).

3. A copy of degree certificate (if you have already graduated).

Due to a high volume of applications received, ONLY successful candidates will be contacted.

In the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, applicants may be requested to undertake the internship remotely in view of constraints regarding visa issuance, international travel and access to UN premises. Applicants must be willing and prepared to undertake the internship remotely for a part or the entirety of the internship. The work hours during the internship shall be determined based on individual discussion between the intern and the supervisor(s) taking into consideration the minimum requirements of the Organization and the time difference between the hosting office and the location of the intern.

United Nations Considerations

According to article 101, paragraph 3, of the Charter of the United Nations, the paramount consideration in the employment of the staff is the necessity of securing the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity. Candidates will not be considered for employment with the United Nations if they have committed violations of international human rights law, violations of international humanitarian law, sexual exploitation, sexual abuse, or sexual harassment, or if there are reasonable grounds to believe that they have been involved in the commission of any of these acts. The term “sexual exploitation” means any actual or attempted abuse of a position of vulnerability, differential power, or trust, for sexual purposes, including, but not limited to, profiting monetarily, socially or politically from the sexual exploitation of another. The term “sexual abuse” means the actual or threatened physical intrusion of a sexual nature, whether by force or under unequal or coercive conditions. The term “sexual harassment” means any unwelcome conduct of a sexual nature that might reasonably be expected or be perceived to cause offence or humiliation, when such conduct interferes with work, is made a condition of employment or creates an intimidating, hostile or offensive work environment, and when the gravity of the conduct warrants the termination of the perpetrator’s working relationship. Candidates who have committed crimes other than minor traffic offences may not be considered for employment.

Due regard will be paid to the importance of recruiting the staff on as wide a geographical basis as possible. The United Nations places no restrictions on the eligibility of men and women to participate in any capacity and under conditions of equality in its principal and subsidiary organs. The United Nations Secretariat is a non-smoking environment.

The paramount consideration in the appointment, transfer, or promotion of staff shall be the necessity of securing the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity. By accepting an offer of appointment, United Nations staff members are subject to the authority of the Secretary-General and assignment by him or her to any activities or offices of the United Nations in accordance with staff regulation 1.2 (c). In this context, all internationally recruited staff members shall be required to move periodically to discharge new functions within or across duty stations under conditions established by the Secretary-General.

Applicants are urged to follow carefully all instructions available in the online recruitment platform, inspira. For more detailed guidance, applicants may refer to the Manual for the Applicant, which can be accessed by clicking on “Manuals” hyper-link on the upper right side of the inspira account-holder homepage.

The evaluation of applicants will be conducted on the basis of the information submitted in the application according to the evaluation criteria of the job opening and the applicable internal legislations of the United Nations including the Charter of the United Nations, resolutions of the General Assembly, the Staff Regulations and Rules, administrative issuances and guidelines. Applicants must provide complete and accurate information pertaining to their personal profile and qualifications according to the instructions provided in inspira to be considered for the current job opening. No amendment, addition, deletion, revision or modification shall be made to applications that have been submitted. Candidates under serious consideration for selection will be subject to reference checks to verify the information provided in the application.

Job openings advertised on the Careers Portal will be removed at 11:59 p.m. (New York time) on the deadline date.

No Fee

THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE AT ANY STAGE OF THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS (APPLICATION, INTERVIEW MEETING, PROCESSING, OR TRAINING). THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CONCERN ITSELF WITH INFORMATION ON APPLICANTS’ BANK ACCOUNTS.

Latent AI, founded in 2019, is a technology spinout from SRI International, based on years of DARPA research. Latent AI takes the hard work out of embedding complex AI models into hardware so developers can speed the time to market. With our Adaptive AI™ technology, which is framework, OS, architecture, and hardware agnostic, we transform the way developers train AI for the edge enabling rapid AI deployment to lean edge devices at scale.

This internship position will involve research and development of algorithms and software systems. Experience with OpenCV, Python, Matlab
Experience using machine learning frameworks (Tensorflow, PyTorch, Keras)

We are seeking the best and brightest 2021 college graduates for our summer internship program. This is a tremendous opportunity to join a world-class marketing team. Approximately 50% of our internships have converted to full-time hires.

Sosemo is an award-winning digital marketing agency that specializes in search marketing, paid social, and media buying. Our internship program lasts approximately 3 months. Interns typically work 4 hours per day, 4 days per week.

During that time, interns rotate across our Paid Search (SEM), SEO, and Paid Social teams. This allows interns to gain a working knowledge of each marketing channel. Accommodations may be made if interns have a preference for a particular channel.

A portion of your time as an intern will be dedicated to training, while the other portion will be spent gaining hands-on experience assisting with campaign management, reporting, and related duties. You may also be required to assist with ad hoc requests such as data entry for new business.

Our internship program pays minimum wage. Consideration will be made to offer a full-time position at the end of 90 days to those who impress. Full-time employees earn a competitive salary, yearly bonus, and benefits.

Our office is located down the street from the New York Stock Exchange at 60 Broad Street. In addition to working with a stellar team, our office has beautiful common areas, weekly yoga/meditation, spectacular views of the Statue of Liberty, and free coffee and beer. Please note: our office is following all CDC guidelines and only allowing 50% capacity at this time. Employees currently have the option to work remotely, though working from our office is encouraged.

Full Job Description
***This position requires you to be located within the U.S.

Townsquare Media is offering an unpaid internship program on our Digital Products team to junior developers. This is an opportunity for you to gain exposure to the many facets of a digital media company, learn from a wide range of coding mentors with decades of experience, gain insight into a dynamic work environment, and expand your professional network as well as the opportunity for full-time employment following completion of the internship.

Who Are We?

Townsquare is a community-focused digital media, digital marketing solutions, and radio company focused outside the top 50 markets in the U.S.

Our assets include Townsquare Interactive, a digital marketing services subscription business providing websites, search engine optimization, social platforms, and online reputation management for small and medium businesses (SMBs); Townsquare IGNITE, a proprietary digital programmatic advertising technology with an in-house demand and data management platform; and Townsquare Media, our portfolio of 322 local terrestrial radio stations in 67 cities with corresponding local news and entertainment websites and apps with a network of national music brands (such as XXL and Taste of Country).

Program Details

This internship will be with the Digital Products team. We build the digital solutions that power all three businesses mentioned above, but the internship will be focused on Townsquare Interactive and Townsquare Media.

12-week, unpaid part-time micro-internship with potential for full-time employment (total time will depend on the internship start, so intern is done before school starts in September)
Full remote (our team is primarily centered around the NY area, but we have members based around the country)

Structure: This program is structured in two parts:
Part 1 Job Rotation (Weeks 1-8): The intern will rotate through eight different teams.
Part 2: Personal Project (Weeks 9-12). During the last four weeks, the intern will work with one of the eight teams on a project of her choice. See below for additional details on the job rotation.
Weekly time commitment: 9 hours
The intern will work with two Team Leads each week
1:1 mentor time per week: 6 hours (will decrease to 3 hours per week during your personal project)
Flexible schedule, but during the workday.
Homework: 2 hours (this will grow when you focus on your personal project)
Group meeting: 1 hour

Qualifications
Rising senior in Computer Science or recent graduate
Knowledge of basic coding languages, especially PHP and JavaScript. (JavaScript is a higher priority.)
Basic programming experience
Ability to learn new software and technologies quickly
Flexibility

Additional Details
Part 1: Job Rotation: the intern will work with eight different teams. The leader of each of those teams will meet 1:1 with the intern, give her small coding assignments, and provide her with feedback on her work. The leader of each team will also share with the intern his/her personal and professional career pathway and help the intern understand how his/her team fits into the overall Townsquare Media company.

Part 2: Personal Project. The intern should note ideas for potential personal projects. During Weeks 9-12, the intern will work more closely with her chosen team to complete her project. During Week 12, the intern will present her Personal Project to the entire team.

How to apply

Please send in:
Resume
Cover letter

One or two coding samples:
This could be a school or personal project, such as HTML/JS/PHP (sent as a ZIP file)
Sent as a ZIP file

Overview:
IS Intern - RIS

The Nationwide Children's Hospital Information Services Department Intern undergoes supervised practical training in their designated field of study. Interns have the opportunity to work with multiple teams within NCH Information Services and are exposed to a broad range of IS technologies and processes. The Intern is responsible for helping with departmental tasks, ad-hoc requests and is actively involved with unit or organization-wide projects. Interns work closely with NCH staff and leaders to conduct research, capture data, attend meetings and develop and implement new processes and initiatives while helping achieve the best outcomes for the hospital.

Why Nationwide Children's Hospital?:
The moment you walk through our doors, you can feel it. When you meet one of our patient families, you believe it. And when you talk with anyone who works here, you want to be part of it, too. Welcome to Nationwide Children’s Hospital, where Passion Meets Purpose.

Here, Everyone Matters. We’re 13,000 strong. And it takes every single one of us to improve the lives of the kids we care for, and the kids from around the world we’ll never even meet. Kids who are living healthier, fuller lives because of the knowledge we share. We know it takes a Collaborative Culture to deliver on our promise to provide the very best, innovative care and to foster new discoveries, made possible by the most groundbreaking research. Anywhere.

Ask anyone with a Nationwide Children’s badge what they do for a living. They’ll tell you it’s More Than a Job. It’s a calling. It’s a chance to use and grow your talent to make an impact that truly matters. Because here, we exist simply to help children everywhere.

Nationwide Children’s Hospital. A Place to Be Proud

#21-00377-Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer-Full Time-No C2C or Visas-No Interns/Trainees Please.

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,

Full Job Description
As a valued member of Cognyte's Video Intelligence Solutions, Technical Support team, you will be responsible for advanced troubleshooting and working to resolve service requests escalated to you. In addition, you will be the first point of contact for customer service inquiries received via the telephone, email, or the customer’s ticketing system. You will be responsible for creating service requests in the Oracle Customer Relationship Management (CRM) application, verifying eligibility for support, troubleshooting, and escalating any unresolved issues by standard escalation procedures. You will also monitor the progress of a service request from its creation to its completion. In addition, you will be responsible for closing the request by the documented process.

Principal Duties and Essential Responsibilities:
  • Responds to a moderate volume of service inquiries within focused verticals, either by phone, email, or the customer’s ticketing system, gathering information about the customer, contacts, eligibility for support, and install-base data. Utilizes this information to create service requests in the Oracle CRM database.
  • Works closely with team members to resolve service requests that have been escalated. Ensures follow-up and detailed feedback are provided.
  • Assesses nature of the problem; Utilizes technical expertise, exercises judgment and decision making to perform troubleshooting to resolve the issue. Works with peers when appropriate to assist in resolving issues.
  • Works with 3rd party hardware manufacturers to open service requests and troubleshoot their hardware remotely.
  • Works with 3rd party vendors to dispatch them for on-site support when required.
  • Processes RMA’s for hardware when required.
  • For more complex issues, escalates issues to the appropriate technical support personnel for resolution.
  • Gains understanding of how the issue was resolved and applied knowledge to future service inquiries.
  • Follows the progress of requests to ensure requests are resolved promptly and that the customer is delighted with the resolution.
  • Closes requests when completed.
  • Performs various administrative and reporting tasks as assigned.
  • Assists in training new employees.
  • Adheres to written or verbally communicated processes.
Minimum Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, and/or equivalent work experience.
  • 0-1+ years of technical support experience, preferably in a call center environment.
  • Excellent customer service and phone etiquette skills.
  • Demonstrable troubleshooting skills, organization, and analytical skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and timeframes.
  • Works well in and supports a team environment.
  • Ability to take direction, retain information, and apply in similar situations.
  • Strong computer skills, including MS Word, Excel, Outlook, Windows Operating Systems.
  • Willingness to work a flexible schedule, including evenings and weekends, if needed.
  • Successful completion of a background screening process including, but not limited to, employment verifications, criminal search, OFAC, SS Verification, as well as credit and drug screening, where applicable and following federal and local regulations.
Preferred Requirements:
  • Formal trouble ticketing system and/or Oracle CRM application experience.
  • Technical training/education and/or certifications highly desirable.
  • Basic understanding of network architecture.
  • Microsoft SQL database support and maintenance.
  • Computer hardware knowledge, including experience with hardware replacement.
  • Basic understanding of Raid Technology, Windows 7 and/or 10, 2008/2012 server knowledge.
  • Understanding system logs and event logs.
This is an intern position - Background check and citizenship as requirements.

Full Job Description
The Software / Embedded Systems Engineer Intern will develop software and firmware for Ayar Labs’ electronic-photonic chips, perform initial chip bringup of custom systems-on-chip (SoC) platforms and assist other engineers during the software and firmware development cycle. As part of these roles, you will be expected to work with microcontrollers, FPGAs, and various board-level hardware/software to achieve the desired system functionality. You will be joining a small team in a dynamic startup environment, where each member is expected to take on a wide range of responsibilities and to learn and grow with the company.

Essential Functions:
Development and optimize firmware/software used for controlling the hardware components of complex electronic-photonic chips with multiple high-speed SerDes
Perform chip bring-up and initial functional test of new custom silicon
Work closely with both integrated circuit designers and optical designers to understand chip features and operating modes
Work closely with test engineers to hand off chip testing platform after initial silicon bringup
Work closely with firmware/software engineers on various programming tasks

Basic Qualifications:
Pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or hsa equivalent skills and/or experience
Illustrates a strong programming background, with developing in both low-level programming languages (C/C++) as well as Python
Understanding of basic circuit theory and electronics at a system level
Proficiency with version control software, such as Git
Self-driven debugger who loves digging deeper to determine a root cause

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in silicon bring-up and firmware development for high-speed SerDes
Experience with high speed digital communications silicon/system products.
Experience working with and interfacing with microcontrollers and/or FPGAs through serial communication
Experience prototyping or designing PCB-level hardware, including schematic design, component selection, chip interface management (SPI, I2C, etc.), and PCB layout

Principals only. Recruiters, payment for recruiting activities is only applicable subject to a signed and executed agreement between the parties. Please don’t contact our hiring managers.

About Ayar Labs

At Ayar Labs we are about to revolutionize computing by moving data with light. We’re unleashing processing power for artificial intelligence, high performance computing, and telecommunications by removing the bottlenecks created by today’s electrical I/O - making it possible to continue scaling computing system performance. Ayar Labs is the first to deliver in-package optical I/O chiplets, a new universal I/O solution that replaces traditional electrical I/O and enables chips to communicate with each other from millimeters to kilometers, to deliver orders of magnitude improvements in latency, bandwidth density, and power consumption.

With our strong collaborations with industry leaders and government, our deep ties to MIT and UC Berkeley, and our commitment to hiring the best engineers in photonics and electronics, joining our team gives you the opportunity to collaborate with renowned experts on challenging, paradigm-shifting work.

We are passionate about delivering in-package optical I/O at scale, leveraging the strength of our patent portfolio and our team of leading interdisciplinary experts. We believe that deep cross-collaboration between teams facilitated by honest, open debate is the best way to drive innovation and achieve big wins. Join our team and experience the possibilities.

Resources:
Executives from Intel and GLOBALFOUNDRIES share their thoughts on Ayar Labs and the promise of in-package optical I/O (video)
Ayar Labs in the News and Recent announcements
LinkedIn and Twitter
Ayar Labs is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and is strongly committed to all policies which will afford equal opportunity employment to all qualified persons without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, creed, gender, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

  • Auxiliary Coordination – Coordination of and support for events related to student organization activity and college-wide activities.
The incumbent also has responsibility for industry related event scheduling in coordination with academic departments, process improvement, and design and implementation of revenue-generating mechanisms.
FLSA Exempt - This position is covered by health benefits, and is exempt, (not eligible for overtime compensation) according to the Fair Labor Standards Act.

Department Information
The College of Engineering and Computer Science is dedicated to providing high quality education that will transform students into professionals capable of contributing to the advancement of technological knowledge, progress, well-being and sustainable growth of our Capital region and the State of California. The mission of the College of Engineering and Computer Science is to focused heavily on producing career-ready engineering, computer science and construction management professionals who possess the critical thinking skills, creativity, communication skills and the problem solving abilities necessary to make an immediate and lasting contribution to their profession. Our sixty-eight full-time faculty members earned their degrees at some of the nation’s best universities. They are dedicated to personally educating and training young people, and share a practical, design-oriented philosophy which encourages independent thinking and problem solving. The academic programs prepare our 4,000 students for both professional practice and advanced study in their chosen disciplines.
https://www.csus.edu/college/engineering-computer-science/

Minimum Qualifications

Knowledge and Abilities:
The following knowledge and abilities as well as those listed at the lower levels in the Student Services Professional series are required for appointment into this classification.

Thorough knowledge of the principles of individual and group behavior. General knowledge of the principles, practices and trends of the Student Services field as well as general knowledge of the policies, procedures and practices of the program area to which assigned; general knowledge of individual counseling techniques; general knowledge, or the ability to rapidly acquire such knowledge, of the organizational procedures and activities of the specific campus to which the position is assigned. Working knowledge of student services programs outside the program to which immediately assigned.

Ability to analyze complex situations accurately and adopt effective courses of action; advise students individually and in groups on complex student‑related matters; determine appropriate courses of action and proper techniques to utilize while engaged with individuals in personal interactions of an argumentative or sensitive nature; interpret and evaluate descriptions and explanations of problems brought forward by individuals or student organizations, analyze and define the problem, draw valid conclusions and project consequences of various alternative courses of action; carry out a variety of professionally complex assignments without detailed instructions; and establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with a variety of individuals.

Experience:
Possession of these knowledge and abilities is typically demonstrated through the equivalent of three years of progressively responsible professional student services work experience. One year in the program area to which assigned may be preferred but is not required.

A master’s degree in Counseling, Clinical Psychology, Social Work, or a directly related field may be substituted for one year of experience. A doctorate degree and the appropriate internship or clinical training in counseling or guidance may be substituted for the three years of experience for positions with a major responsibility for professional career or personal counseling.

Education:
Equivalent to graduation from a four-year college or university in a related field, including or supplemented by upper division or graduate course work in counseling techniques, interviewing, and conflict resolution where such are job-related.

Full Job Description

Posted under: * Survey & Mapping, Technologies*
What does this student internship entail?
Under the supervision of a Survey Director and/or Senior Survey Technician, the Student Intern will utilize their knowledge of software, computer hardware, mathematics, communication, and other physical sciences to assist in the planning and execution of data processing projects. Upon completion of the internship, the Student Intern will be expected to present learning highlights from their employment to a group of peers and supervisors.
The Student Intern Will:

  • Shadow the data processing and procedures of a Senior Survey Technician to help develop large scale databases and project deliverables.
  • Assist in the development of cutting-edge software related tools and workflows.
  • Assist in the attribution of survey grade linework for inclusion into Fenstermaker’s archiving system.
  • Participate in project meetings.
  • Coordinate with field crews to collect project specific survey information with the assistance of a Senior Survey Technician.
  • Develop project methodology reports.
  • Generate survey plats, maps, and other deliverables.

Am I qualified for this position?

  • Currently enrolled in electronics, computer science, or other related programs from a nationally accredited college or university
  • Must have completed at least 29 hours of college coursework.
  • Survey experience is a plus.
  • Ability to work outside for days at a time may be required.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to work in both individual and team environments.
  • Authorized to work in the United States.

Why work for Fenstermaker?

Family

Job Type: Internship

Full Job Description
Job Description

At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.

Position Overview:
Are you looking for an inclusive company culture to ease the transition from college into the workforce? The Internal Audit division within Freddie Mac is searching for collaborative and creative individuals to join our organization!

We have a dynamic environment with constant change, enabling interns to grow with us through a wide variety of experiences and responsibilities. Interns at Freddie Mac have the opportunity to actively work on real-world projects while developing skills that will apply directly to their careers and provide them broad exposure to Freddie Mac's outstanding role in the mortgage industry!

Our Impact:
Freddie Mac’s Internal Audit division plays a meaningful role in the company’s approach to managing risk by providing independent, objective, and value-added assurance of risk management, governance, and controls.

Your Impact:
You will support Internal Audit by working on high-impact audit projects that evaluate Freddie Mac’s business, including the opportunity to develop and present your recommendations for improvement to management.
You will work collaboratively with your colleagues to execute projects, sharing knowledge and building relationships with an audit team comprised of diverse talents, backgrounds, experience, and skillsets.
You will learn about key areas of Freddie Mac’s business, including related risks and internal controls, from external partners across the organization.

Qualifications:
Minimum cumulative 3.2 GPA
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Audit, Management Information Systems, Data Analytics, or Business Administration with an emphasis on Technology, Computer Science, Accounting Information Systems or a related field
Availability to begin internship in May 2022, with expected graduation Fall 2022 or Spring 2023 graduation

Keys to Success in this Role:
Must work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Must be a phenomenal teammate and able to work collaboratively
Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal

Current Freddie Mac employees please apply through the internal career site.

Today, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will ensure that individuals with differing abilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Notice to External Search Firms: Freddie Mac partners with BountyJobs for contingency search business through outside firms. Resumes received outside the BountyJobs system will be considered unsolicited and Freddie Mac will not be obligated to pay a placement fee. If interested in learning more, please visit www.BountyJobs.com and register with our referral code: MAC.

position: Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please
description:
Full Job Description
My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1).
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

#21-00377-Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer-Full Time-No C2C or Visas-No Interns/Trainees Please.

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist

Full Job Description
Indy Acoustic Research is seeking a summer engineering intern to assist with
development of tools and apparatus and perform acoustic measurements for a small
business specializing in Engineering Acoustic Design. This position requires a general
knowledge of science and engineering processes, product development, and acute
knowledge in an engineering discipline such as mechanical design, electrical design,
computer science, physics or acoustics. Must be self-starter who can work in a small,
dynamic group environment and has attention to detail. Should have a desire to design
and build objects using Mechanical or Electrical CAD software, 3D printing, and
assembly using hand tools. May conduct or setup acoustic measurements in Anechoic
chamber, Diffuse Sound booth, or Recording Studio and summarize results using
spreadsheets. Knowledge of Physical Acoustics or DAW/Recording software a plus.
Example Duties Actual duties may vary based upon expertise of intern. May include:
  • Design Mechanical CAD of test fixtures using Autodesk Fusion 360
  • Operate and post-process prints from FDM and/or SLA 3D printers
  • Assembly of components such as plastic or metal enclosures, circuit boards and
transducers using mechanical fasteners or adhesives.
  • Run acoustic test scripts on microphones and/or speakers to obtain frequency
response, polar pattern, distortion and other metrics.
  • Set up and calibrate test equipment following verbal instructions and/or written
procedures
  • Write VBA scripts to automatically process or manipulate excel data.
Required
Qualifications
  • Must be 18 years of age
  • Must be able to speak and write fluent English
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook and Excel)
  • Self-Directed and able to work and innovate without supervision, including selftaught learning of new software and hardware.
  • Second-year University level completion of Physics, Calculus, and specialized
engineering courses.
  • General knowledge of in-air Acoustics and Acoustic measures such as: Hertz, dB(SPL),
frequency weighting, averaging, and wave propagation theory
Desired
Qualifications
  • Experience with 3D printing and fabrication
  • Experience with sound recording software such as Digital Audio Workstations
(DAW’s, e.g. Audacity, Audition or Reaper), Room EQ Wizard, or Listen SoundCheck
  • Mechanical design experience using 3D CAD software
  • Familiarity with Raspberry Pi platform, and Linux shell
  • Ability to code in Matlab, Visual Basic/VBA, LabView or Python
  • Ability to solder
Other
Requirements
  • Must agree to industry standard disclosures and use policies, including:
o Confidential Information Non-Disclosure Agreement
o Prior Invention Disclosure
o Invention Ownership Agreement
o Code of Conduct
o Conflict of Interest Policy
o Computing and Cybersecurity Policy
Location Indy Acoustic Research LLC
6602 E. 75
th St. Ste 105
Indianapolis, Indiana 46250
Travel Not Required.
Work Hours • 20-39 Hrs/week, flexible hours within standard office work week.
Benefits • None
Compensation $20 / hour
Job Number E-21001-Engineering Intern

Please Direct Qualified Inquiries to:
contact@indyacousticresearch.com
