Full Job Description
Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. At Dolby, science meets art, and high tech means more than computer code. As a member of the Dolby team, you’ll see and hear the results of your work everywhere, from movie theaters to smartphones.

As an intern, the Dolby U program offers impactful, project-based work experience in a collaborative, creative environment where you work side by side with industry leaders. Amplify your insatiable curiosity by implementing real-world solutions that revolutionize how people communicate and how entertainment is created, delivered, and enjoyed worldwide. For anyone seeking to gain invaluable expertise through meaningful, personal contributions, join us to design a future where technology meets entertainment!

SUMMARY
Dolby’s Applied Vision Science Group is a small collaborative team within Dolby that investigates perceptual aspects of the human visual system and turns what we learn into image processing algorithms for improving perceived video quality. Understanding the relationship between science, art, and engineering is key to doing this well. Our group is looking for a motivated and energetic engineer/scientist to join our team in Sunnyvale, CA, and contribute to this meaningful effort.

One of the questions that intrigue us is “How do we perceive motion?”. Our goal is to expand the reach of deep learning algorithms to address the question. We are specifically looking for a talented, curious, and inventive individual to assist in developing deep learning approaches to frame rate conversion algorithms. You will apply your skills in deep learning architectures to invent novel network architectures for converting between a wide range of frame rates, and applicable to a wide range of content. You will help the team investigate and improve the cost functions and datasets required for training, subjectively and objectively evaluate, and demonstrate the results, and work with engineering teams and product management to deploy the algorithms in a wide variety of processing environments (cloud, servers, GPU, SoC).

RESPONSIBILITIES

Invent novel CNN architectures for converting to both higher and lower arbitrary frame rates, for a wide range of content types, with the very highest level of visual quality
Work with expert engineering teams to deploy deep learning algorithms to a wide range of processing environments while maintaining our high standards for image quality
Deliver internal and external technology presentations and feasibility/proof of performance demonstrations
Generate new intellectual property, in the form of patents, workflows, ecosystems, and know-how
Write software that is efficient, clean, modular, bug-free, understandable to others, and well documented

QUALIFICATIONS

Understanding of human perception (how we see and interpret motion)
Experience in developing deep neural network training and optimization in leading frameworks (e.g. Pytorch, Tensorflow) (Experience deploying deep neural networks in products desirable)
Experience using Matlab/Python for image processing
Experience with GPU programming
Track record of successful research accomplishments, published papers, and/or patent applications in the field of color science and/or video processing.
Excellent communication and critical thinking skills; ability to prototype quickly; a team-oriented work ethic, and ability to work under minimal supervision

Familiarity with and/or strong interest in learning about:
Media streaming technology
Audio and/or video fundamentals and encoding methods
Data analytics

ELIGIBILITY

Working towards a Master’s degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Imaging Science, Computer Graphics or a related field; recent grads who are within 6 months of graduation are also eligible to apply.
Must be available to work full-time Monday – Friday for 3 months between September 2021 – December 2021. The start date for this position is Monday, September 20, 2021. Please note the start date is not flexible.

Dolby will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code, Article 49, and Administrative Code, Article 12

Equal Employment Opportunity:
Dolby is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Our success depends on the combined skills and talents of all our employees. We are committed to making employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, marital status, family status, medical condition, disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances.

Full Job Description
Are you ready to join a growing team that puts a premium on productivity and has an award-winning culture, centered around transforming talented employees into effective business leaders?

Then Bankers Healthcare Group is the place for you. We offer innovative financial solutions to licensed and highly-skilled professionals, representing the best of both traditional lending and fintech, and are looking for passionate, impact players to help take our company to the next level.

At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.

With over 19 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

Who You Are
You are a motivated student pursuing a degree in computer science and are passionate about custom application development. You are driven, logical, and innovative and thrive in a fast-paced environment where you can create custom applications from scratch.
What You'll Do
Work with the loan originations development team
Analyze critical processes
Design and integrate a reporting utility that will be used to notify business and operations of critical issues

What You'll Need
Currently enrolled Computer Science major or an equivalent discipline
Understands basic object-oriented concepts
Familiar with programming in modern languages such as C# or Java
Working knowledge of relational databases
Out of the box thinking to identify patterns
Good written and verbal skills
Exemplifies the ability to collaborate with teammates to produce quick and efficient solutions
Life at BHG
At BHG, we work hard and aren’t afraid to take risks. Since the beginning, our core values of PMA (positive mental attitude), team player and loyalty have been the driving force behind every interaction we have between each other and our customers. We have a healthy respect for the daily grind, yet we value work/life balance. We believe that all employees should have the opportunity to lead and that good ideas can come from anyone. From the top-down, our leaders are actively involved not only in strategic oversight and running the business, but also in the wellbeing and growth of all employees. We consider people our #1 asset, and help employees realize their full potential, set and exceed their goals, and explore new opportunities for personal and professional development.

Why You Should Join BHG
We strive to offer amenities, opportunities, events, and programming that support the interests of our teams, while furthering the culture that makes us Great Place to Work® certified. Some of the benefits you can expect when you join BHG include:

  • 100% coverage of monthly health insurance premiums
  • Competitive PTO and vacation policies
  • Company 401(k) plan with employer contributions after one year
  • On-site gym access and memberships, with personal trainers, and certified nutritionists on staff
  • Company-sponsored training and certification opportunities
  • Monthly award ceremonies where top achievers are celebrated and receive additional bonuses
  • Ongoing volunteer opportunities to give back to the community through our BHG Cares program
If you’re ready for a career where you can exercise your passions, be surrounded by co-workers who are relentlessly committed to service, and have a team-player mindset, apply today!

** All Remote employee's at Bankers Healthcare Group are required to work within the United States of America.

Bankers Healthcare Group is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

ShipHawk is the premier packing and shipping software for ERP connected companies. We work with high volume retail, wholesale and eCommerce companies that have outgrown basic shipping software.

Come join us as we transform one of the last massive old-school industries into a transparent, efficient market, benefiting both retailers and consumers. Join a startup where you can make an impact, grow your career, and have a voice.

With combined annual sales of more than $8.5 billion and 22,000+ employees worldwide, the DIC Group companies support a diverse collection of global customers.

Sun Chemical Corporation is a subsidiary of Sun Chemical Group Coöperatief U.A., the Netherlands, and is headquartered in Parsippany, New Jersey, U.S.A. For more information, please visit our website at www.sunchemical.com or connect with us on LinkedIn or Twitter.

Description:
The Supply Chain Data Analytics Intern is responsible for collecting, preparing, analyzing and managing the business data for the Performance Pigment Global Supply Chain. This internship will have responsibility for managing information from SAP to enable Sales & Operations Planning, Inventory Planning, Master Scheduling and Order Fulfillment at targeted customer service levels. This person will provide business data for existing reporting systems, key initiatives and metrics.

The Supply Chain Data Analytics Intern will provide insight into issues and consult with management with regards to trends and resolution of demand and supply imbalances and make actionable recommendations to the business leader. S/he will assist in business improvement projects to help drive automation, visibility and transparency in the Global Supply Chain.

Process a variety of complex data and reports to help drive improvements in the Sales and Operation Planning process.
Provide business data for existing reporting systems, key initiatives, and metrics.
Support various projects for the Supply Chain Department with emphasis on automation of the data.
Track, analyze and interpret trends of patterns to drive action to improve the demand and supply planning process.
Maintain accurate data through the use of analytical tools, database management and utilizing SAP tables.
Other duties as assigned

Position Requirements:
Required Education and Experience

Associate Degree/BS Degree/working towards a BS degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems or Supply Chain

Preferred Education and Experience

1-3 years Supply Chain and SAP experience.
Proficient in all Microsoft software programs.
Some experience in Access MS office.
Experience in data visualization tools a plus.
Some experience in programming language VBA/VB script.

description:
Full Job Description
My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1).
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

#21-00377-Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer-Full Time-No C2C or Visas-No Interns/Trainees Please.

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist

Full Job Description
Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. At Dolby, science meets art, and high tech means more than computer code. As a member of the Dolby team, you’ll see and hear the results of your work everywhere, from movie theaters to smartphones.

As an intern, the Dolby U program offers impactful, project-based work experience in a collaborative, creative environment where you work side by side with industry leaders. Amplify your insatiable curiosity by implementing real-world solutions that revolutionize how people communicate and how entertainment is created, delivered, and enjoyed worldwide. For anyone seeking to gain invaluable expertise through meaningful, personal contributions, join us to design a future where technology meets entertainment!

SUMMARY
Join the IT Enterprise Applications team to work with internal business units, business systems analysts, and end-users on improving the usability of our Enterprise Applications. Starting with a business application (e.g. Salesforce), put together current process flows, conduct focus group discussions, identify areas for improvement, and propose recommendations. Learn about Project Management LifeCycle and do a project deployment of the recommendations may also be included.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Schedule and conduct interviews, discussions, and brainstorming sessions with various application stakeholders using a variety of methods including phone conversations, emails, surveys, and electronic chat
Synthesize information gained from sessions into documentation that can include flow charts, diagrams, mock-ups, and user stories
Work with IT Business Systems Analysts to refine documentation into recommendations for potential system changes
Present findings to internal business units and IT teams for review and comment
Learn the Project Management LifeCycle (as used at Dolby) and prepare a project plan utilizing it
Initiate and manage a mutually agreed project to address an area of improvement from the findings of the earlier analysis
Assist IT Business Systems Analysts with additional tasks related to projects, enhancements, and bug fixes
Plan, organize, and prioritize own daily work routine to meet established schedule
Work in an ambiguous environment supporting various stakeholders
Communicate analysis and project status on regular schedule via web page and email
Complete additional assigned tasks as directed by Manager

QUALIFICATIONS

Proficiency with Microsoft Office products such as Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Familiarity with Process Documentation tools such as MS Visio, Jira, Miro Board, and Lucid Chart are very helpful
Academic or Working knowledge of the stages of a software implementation project (Waterfall or Agile methodology)
Excellent communication skills and able to work in person and across phone, video, chat, and email; able to interact with users from across the globe and varying levels of expertise with technology
Ability to work in a fast-paced multi-tasking environment

ELIGIBILITY

Working towards a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Systems, Engineering, Computer Science or a related field. Will consider candidates minoring in the above subject areas or with equivalent and relevant work experience
Must be available to work full-time Monday – Friday for 6 months between September 2021 – March 2022. The start date for this position is Monday, September 20, 2021. Please note the start date is not flexible.

Dolby will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code, Article 49, and Administrative Code, Article 12

Equal Employment Opportunity:
Dolby is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Our success depends on the combined skills and talents of all our employees. We are committed to making employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, marital status, family status, medical condition, disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances.

Nearest Secondary Market: Oakland

Volvo Group Trucks Technology (GTT), a division of Volvo Group North America, provide state-of-the-art research, engineering, product planning and project execution to final delivery of complete products and support the products in the aftermarket.

Position Description:
We are currently looking for a student to work with our Simulation and Application Team as an Engineering Intern. The student should be prepared to work in a challenging and fast-paced environment; gaining experience and knowledge in various aspects of engineering and software. As a valued member of the Simulation and Application Team within GTT, the student will have the opportunity to work directly with engineering. GTT’s goal is to contribute to the student’s development, as well as providing an opportunity for the student to work in a business environment within the manufacturing industry. This position will report to Simulation and Application Manager.

Position Responsibilities:
Conduct Analytics Assignments
Recognizing patterns in data, information, or events & drawing logical conclusions
Pull Log Vehicle Data from SQL database
Use Matlab or Python to efficiency review time series data
Collaborate with technology engineers to setup Power BI dashboards
Setup and conduct Simulations Using Matlab/Simulink
Simulations focus on ECU software functionality such as OBD diagnostics
Create, update and follow time plan
Highlight need for support and resource issues
Contribute to process & organizational development of our analytics tools
Assist with setup and maintenance of data loggers

Attention to Detail: Provide accurate data and reports that are pertinent to the team’s tasks.
Teamwork: Building cooperation among individuals and departments, sharing information and resources, and working to achieve group goals and outcomes.
Communication: Listen effectively, transmit information accurately and understandably, and actively seek feedback from experienced engineers, project manager, etc.
Dependability/Reliability: Follow through on commitments, timely delivery on projects, assigned tasks, etc.
Flexibility: Willing to perform a wide range of tasks, positive responds to changes in direction and priorities, and acceptance of new challenges, responsibilities, and assignments.

Strong communication skills
Valid US Work authorization
Programming skill and experience in Python,R, SQL, Power BI & Matlab/Simulink-Microsoft Applications: (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
Experience with Diesel engine technology is a plus
Working remote is allowed for this position. However, 10% of time will require on-site work at the site in Hagerstown Maryland.

Customer Focus
Technical Skills
Peer Relationships
Integrity and Trust
Standing Alone
Action Oriented
Perseverance

The Volvo Group drives prosperity through transport solutions, offering trucks, buses, construction equipment, power solutions for marine and industrial applications, financing and services that increase our customers’ uptime and productivity. Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek - so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

As an Intern, you will apply your function specific sophomore year coursework to a variety of focused hands-on projects. At the same time, you will gain and apply knowledge about Agilent's industry, infrastructure and products in your assignment. This is developing real world experience in a company that is a leader in the markets it serves.

We are looking for a candidate with an interest in the practical application of security principles across cloud computing environments such as AWS, Microsoft Azure, and GCP. This will be an ideal opportunity for a student in Cyber Security, Computer Science, or related disciplines, looking to develop practical skills and experience at the forefront of rapidly evolving change in the technology industry.

As a Cloud Security intern, your responsibilities will include the following:

Assess the security posture of solutions and environments running on major cloud service providers such as AWS, Microsoft Azure, and GCP
Collaborate with teams on development and implementation of service specific security practices
Work with independent software vendors to apply, test, and evaluate security and governance solutions for the cloud
Document findings from ISV collaborations and development of security practices
Build taxonomy of cloud security risks structured around a hierarchy of classes, subclasses, and elements
Participate in planning and execution of attack simulations on accounts and assets in AWS and Microsoft Azure

Requirements:
Completion of sophomore (typically second) year at an accredited 4-year university required.

Enrollment in an accredited educational institution working towards a degree or certification in Cyber Security, Computer Science, or similar technical concentration
Demonstrated problem solving skills
Proven ability to work independently and within a team environment
Proactively identify problems and solutions
Demonstrated passion for cybersecurity and ability to think like a threat actor
Design experiments and models for addressing internal and external threats
Collaborative personality
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
Self-motivation and attention to detail
Ability to formulate solutions and options in the absence of examples or past precedence

We have year-round internships at our Sussex headquarters that requires working part-time during the Spring and Fall semesters (15-20 hours/week) and full-time during the Summer (37.5-40 hours/week). We are seeking students who can start immediately.

Full Job Description
Acronis sets the standard for cyber protection and our mission is to empower people by providing them with cutting edge technology that will enable them to monitor, control, and protect the data that their business' and lives depend on.

As a Cloud Frontline Support Specialist Intern you will be responsible for helping support MSP's, partners and customers of Acronis, and resolving Acronis Cyber Platform technical incidents with help from available resources (knowledge base, public and internal documentation) and by coordinating with other team members within our Support organization. You will learn how to craft solutions and deliver initial product setup, perform initial issue troubleshooting, escalate issues to the next Support level, and communicate with MSPs to their complete satisfaction. This job is perfectly suited for a recent graduate or individual who wants to get hands-on experience and start their career in technical support. This role requires an individual who has great technical knowledge, interacts well with others, and has effective communication skills.

Every member of our "A-Team" has an instrumental role and impact on the success of Acronis' business, so we are looking for a highly-motivated individual who thrives in a fast-paced and high-volume, work environment. The ideal candidate for this position will not only possess the skills and experience required but will also possess a positive attitude and ability to solve complex problems and work in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment. And just like every position at Acronis, the ideal candidate will embody all of our company values: responsive, alert, detail-oriented, makes decisions, and never gives up.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Answer how-to questions and customer care requests related to Acronis Cyber Platform
Work on resolving various technical incidents for the MSPs involving Acronis products.
Perform technical analysis of a technical issue and define an action plan for fixing it.
Be responsible for building and maintaining strong relationships with partners.
Maintain deep knowledge of Company operations to support partners' requests effectively.
Interact with various departments (Experts, Partner Success, Analysts) to analyze and resolve problems.
Meet and exceed KPIs set for your role (customer satisfaction, productivity, interaction quality and others).

REQUIREMENTS:
Technical Support knowledge and/or education in IT/Computer Science related fields
Fluent English (both verbal and written)
Eager to learn and grow
Good communication skills and customer service, ability to prioritize and switch between a variety of time-sensitive issues
Passion for troubleshooting, and ability to come up with efficient solutions for complex cross-platform issues
Experience/knowledge in any of the following areas strongly preferred:
Knowledge of Windows Server administration basics (know how to gather and analyze various Windows logs and dumps)
Experience and knowledge of Linux/UNIX basics, CLI
Awareness of the modern Virtualization technologies (experience deploying and managing virtual machines on VMware ESXi / Microsoft Hyper-V clusters)
Experience with Business applications (MS Exchange, MS SQL, MySQL, Oracle DB, Citrix XenApp, NTP servers)

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.

Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.

Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.

Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

About Aaron's:
We are Aaron’s - an industry leader in the sales and lease-to-own retail industry known for quality brand names and superior customer service. We provide our team members the opportunity to reach their full potential in a team-oriented, high-energy, recognition-based environment with competitive pay and benefits. About Aaron's Tech:
In recent years, we’ve been on a journey to transform our business model with technology. We're not the slow, old-fashioned retailer you think we are. We used to be, but those days are long gone. In fact, we don't even think of Aaron's as a retail company. Instead, we think of Aaron's as a technology company that happens to sell and lease furniture, electronics and appliances. This way of thinking has demanded a massive shift in who we hire, how we organize and lead our teams, and how we deliver our technology and services. It's simple: we hire smart people who are motivated by delivering big, impactful results, we point them at big problems to solve, and we get out of their way.

We believe our technology team is unique and special, and after learning about us, we believe you will think so too. Find out more at http://tech.aarons.com/.
